Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 60+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.


Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.


We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. Title: Data Analyst (Auth0)
Description:
Get to know Okta

Okta is The World‚Äôs Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology, anywhere, on any device or app. Our flexible and neutral products, Okta Platform and Auth0 Platform, provide secure access, authentication, and automation, placing identity at the core of business security and growth.

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we‚Äôre looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences.

Join our team! We‚Äôre building a world where Identity belongs to you.

The Data Enablement Team

Auth0 is an easy-to-implement authentication and authorization platform designed by developers for developers. We make access to applications safe, secure, and seamless for the more than 100 million daily logins around the world. Our modern approach to identity enables this Tier 0 global service to deliver convenience, privacy, and security so customers can focus on innovation.

Within the Data organization, the Data Enablement team is chartered with creating scalable semantic models that make it safe for anyone to see and understand data. By partnering with product and engineering leaders, this team owns the data lifecycle from strategy to prototyping to implementation, executive dashboard and product level self-service support.

The Data Analyst Opportunity

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Data Enablement - this role will be responsible for unlocking analytics across the company. You will do this through a combination of data lifecycle ownership, data tooling enablement and outreach programs designed to foster the safe usage of scalable data models for reporting and analytic consumption.

In this dynamic role, you will partner with product, engineering and program management to ensure that our product is emitting signals that enable us to measure product entitlement, adoption and utilization. You will triangulate product and customer needs with a variety of measurement options to create a set of semantic models that represent product usage for any audience. You will then internally promote the ongoing model development through creative and engaging communications to our stakeholders.

An average week will find you planning measurement strategies with product leaders, reviewing engineering plans to capture critical data signals, developing data products that drive success metrics and creating documentation to ensure clarity, consistency and long-term usability. You will have multiple tools and teams at your disposal to achieve the core outcome of creating product and customer insights across the product unit.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Partner with peers in product, engineering and program management to develop scalable measurement strategies for our products and services
Drive scalable, semantic data models that can reach stakeholders both inside of Auth0 and across the enterprise
Educate and enlighten data stakeholders with newly available objects and models that will unlock product and business insights
Form deep knowledge of a single product domain while exerting influence over other product domains
Build reusable data models that support key concepts of the business (Entitlement, Activation, Utilization, Incidents, Developers, Quality, etc.)
Deliver executive dashboards and product insights based on foundational productionalized data models
Partner with other analysts to create composite measures and insights that span the product unit
Ensure that data privacy and governance is a first priority at all stages of the data lifecycle


What You‚Äôll Bring To The Role


3+ years of experience in data management, data engineering, data analytics, product management or a similar background
3+ years of hands on experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc)
2+ years of SQL experience
Strong understanding of data lifecycle management including instrumentation, governance, modeling and self-service interfaces
Build relationships with partners and stakeholders to understand product data needs, distill business requirements into technical documentation and prioritize work accordingly
Excellent business acumen and emotional intelligence in ambiguous environments
BA or higher, preferred; additional relevant work experience in lieu of a degree is acceptable


And extra credit if you have experience in any of the following!


Third party web analytics tools (Heap, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.)
Cloud based data warehouse technologies (Snowflake, BigQuery, Databricks, etc.)
Data engineering (dbt, Fivetran, Python, Kafka, Parquet, Hightouch, etc.)
Paywall, subscription or authentication based products


What you can look forward to as a Full-Time Okta employee!


Amazing Benefits
Making Social Impact
Developing Talent and Fostering Connection + Community at Okta


Okta cultivates a dynamic work environment, providing the best tools, technology and benefits to empower our employees to work productively in a setting that best and uniquely suits their needs. Each organization is unique in the degree of flexibility and mobility in which they work so that all employees are enabled to be their most creative and successful versions of themselves, regardless of where they live. Find your place at Okta today! https://www.okta.com/company/careers/.

Some roles may require travel to one of our office locations for in-person onboarding.

Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, marital status, age, physical or mental disability, or status as a protected veteran. We also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and convictions records, consistent with applicable laws.

If reasonable accommodation is needed to complete any part of the job application, interview process, or onboarding please use this Form to request an accommodation.

Okta is committed to complying with applicable data privacy and security laws and regulations. For more information, please see our Privacy Policy at https://www.okta.com/privacy-policy/.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
üöÄ Data Analyst | Join a Fast-Growing FoodTech Startup in Madrid







üëã Who are we?

Founded in 2012, Take a Chef was born from the belief that exceptional culinary experiences should be accessible beyond traditional restaurant settings.

We envisioned a world where top-tier chefs could bring their talents directly to the dining tables of discerning individuals and families. üçΩÔ∏è

Combining cutting-edge technology üíª with a deep passion for food and hospitality ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•, we‚Äôve become the leading global platform for high-quality private chef services.

Last year, we served over 500,000 clients in more than 100+ countries, working with a network of 70,000+ private chefs and partnering with renowned luxury travel brands like Airbnb, Onefinestay, Le Collectionist and more. ‚ú®







üéØ About the role

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst who‚Äôs passionate about turning complex data into clear, actionable insights. If you love understanding business challenges, building dashboards, and automating data processes to empower decision-making across teams‚Äîthis might be your next role.







üõ†Ô∏è Responsibilities

üîç Deeply understand our business, products, and processes through data
üìä Create and maintain dashboards to track key metrics and visualize insights
üìà Generate reports and visualizations to communicate findings with clarity and impact
ü§ù Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Product, Design, and Marketing to support their data needs
üß∞ Design scripts and tools to automate and streamline data extraction using Python, SQL, and APIs







‚úÖ Requirements

üéì Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics)
üíº At least 3 years of experience working as a Data Analyst
üß† Strong experience (2+ years) with SQL, BigQuery, and Dataflow
üöÄ Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, autonomous environment
üåç Fluency in English and Spanish
üìä Experience with BI tools like Looker, Tableau, or Power BI
ü§ñ Proven track record of integrating AI solutions into day-to-day data analysis workflows (e.g., automating reports, enhancing data pipelines, building smart dashboards).
üìà Hands-on experience (2+ years) with HubSpot and Amplitude (nice to have)







Why choose us?

üíº Positive Work Environment: Thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture that values personal well-being and team spirit.
‚öñÔ∏è Work-Life Balance: We prioritize flexibility and support so you can flourish both professionally and personally.
üìö Employee Development: Paid training and workshops to help you grow and achieve your career goals.
üí∞ Competitive Compensation: We offer attractive salaries and annual bonuses to reward your impact.
üå¥ Paid Time Off: Enjoy 25 vacation days per year to relax, recharge, and explore your passions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

Our Group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Together with our 96.000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are committed to accelerating the transition to a carbon neutral economy through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally friendly solutions.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to lead the digital transformation of business operations by streamlining workflows and developing robust, scalable data solutions that enhance performance and support data-driven decision-making.

Mission

Your mission is to drive the digital transformation of business processes by automating workflows and delivering high-quality, scalable data solutions that support performance optimization and informed decision-making. You will act as a key contributor across the entire data stack‚Äîfrom ETL pipelines and data modeling to the development of impactful BI dashboards‚Äîwhile ensuring technical excellence, operational stability, and continuous service improvement.

You will also play a proactive role in managing operational issues, addressing escalations, and supporting major incident and problem management, contributing to service excellence and customer satisfaction across the organization.

Functions


Automate and optimize recurrent business processes through scripting and data tools.
Design and build scalable data architecture and pipelines (ETL/ELT).
Develop and maintain performance monitoring dashboards and BI reports (Power BI).
Ensure the quality, scalability, and maintainability of solutions through rigorous testing and adherence to best practices.
Manage and report application service performance, addressing gaps and proposing improvements.
Participate in incident management, root cause analysis, and problem resolution.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to align data solutions with strategic objectives.
Support the definition of data governance frameworks, reporting standards, and performance indicators.
Contribute to customer satisfaction and continuous improvement initiatives.


Minium requirement


2+ years of experience in data modeling, ETL/ELT development, and data warehousing.
Proven experience with SQL/NoSQL databases, AWS services, and data engineering tools.
Strong background in Python, Apache Airflow, Spark, and Lambda Functions.
Experience deploying end-to-end solutions
Proficiency in python and BI tools (e.g., Power BI).
Solid understanding of database design principles.
Hands-on experience in data architecture, pipeline development, and cloud-based services (AWS).
Fluent in English


Committed to inclusion

At ENGIE we value and encourage diversity and inclusion. We are committed to accelerating the transition to a carbon neutral economy achieved through the integration of exceptional and diverse individuals who seek, support and strengthen the growth of others.

What We Provide


You will have a flexible schedule and a hybrid work syste
You will have the opportunity to join the flexible compensation system (transport card, childcare voucher, training, meal voucher, health insurance, among others)
You will be part of a dynamic team where you will truly develop and grow as a professional
You will work with a multidisciplinary team that will support you at all time
You will be part of a network of professionals working to create a more sustainable world.


ENGIE is the answer if...


You are looking for a solid professional project with professional projection.
You value being part of the first independent energy group in the world.
You want to grow and develop within a dynamic and challenging company.
If you consider that your work, together with the efforts of the people who arE part of the company, can and should have a positive impact on the environment.
If you want to be part of an international group, able to offer a wide variety of jobs in a dynamic and promising sector, we are waiting for you!


Business Unit: GBU Renewables

Division: REN Europe - Spain

Legal Entity: Engie Espa√±a Renovables, S.L.U.

Professional Experience: Skilled ( >3 experience <15 years)

Education Level: Bachelor's Degree

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¬øTe apasiona el BigData? ¬øQuieres formar parte de un equipo con una de las trayectorias m√°s solventes en el mundo del Machine Learning, Analytics y BigData? ¬øTe apetece trabajar en una compa√±√≠a joven, participativa y especializada?




Para ello solo exigimos un requisito, que tus respuestas a las preguntas anteriores hayan sido: ¬°S√ç!

En M√°tica Partners, trabajamos continuamente para mantenernos a la vanguardia tecnol√≥gica, y adem√°s somos una empresa People Centric, ponemos al trabajador en el centro de todo lo que hacemos. Creemos en una cultura horizontal, sin egos, en un entorno donde se valoran tanto las ideas como las personas.




Buscamos a un/a Data Analyst con 2 a√±os de experiencia en an√°lisis de datos para generar insights accionables y apoyar la toma de decisiones basada en data.




¬øQu√© buscamos?




Experiencia en Tableau en entornos reales.
Experiencia demostrada en SQL.
Alto nivel de ingl√©s. Te integrar√°s en un equipo internacional y tu nivel de ingl√©s debe ser alto, tanto escrito como hablado.
Valorable experiencia en PowerBI, Looker.
Valorable experiencia con AWS.
Valoraremos experiencia realizando procesos ETL.
Se valorar√° conocimientos de Python.




¬øC√≥mo ser√° tu d√≠a a d√≠a?




Comenzar√°s cada jornada con una reuni√≥n diaria de seguimiento de proyecto donde compartir√°s avances, bloqueos y pr√≥ximos pasos con el equipo.
Tendr√°s autonom√≠a para organizar tu trabajo, gestionando tus tareas y tiempos de forma flexible, con foco en la entrega de valor y resultados.
Participar√°s en reuniones de equipo semanales para compartir aprendizajes y fomentar la colaboraci√≥n.
Te reunir√°s directamente con el cliente para presentar avances, resolver dudas y entender mejor sus necesidades.




¬øQu√© ofrecemos?




Contrato indefinido y salario entre los 28.000 y 34.000 (a valorar seg√∫n experiencia) euros brutos/a√±o de entrada, (nuestro plan de carrera incluye 2 revisiones anuales). Tambi√©n tendr√°s a tu disposici√≥n un plan de formaci√≥n especializado, participaci√≥n en la propiedad y los beneficios de M√°tica: Wetaca gratuito en la oficina dos d√≠as a la semana, horario flexible con facilidades para trabajar desde donde quieras, seguro de salud, retribuci√≥n flexible con Cobee, adem√°s de las vacaciones habituales, ofrecemos una semana extra en Navidad y tres d√≠as adicionales en Semana Santa. Tambi√©n recibir√°s un divertido Welcome Kit con port√°til (podr√°s escoger entre varios modelos Mac o Windows), m√≥vil, botella personalizada, auriculares bluetooth y golosinas.

Cuando est√©s en nuestra oficina, en el centro de Barcelona o Madrid, la fruta, los caf√©s y los refrescos corren a cuenta de M√°tica. ¬°Ah! Y si eres amante de los animales, te gustar√° saber esto: ¬°nuestras oficinas son Pet-friendly!




Si te interesa, escr√≠benos por LinkedIn o env√≠a tu CV a anna.garriga@maticapartners.com

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Pozuelo de Alarc√≥n, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Verisure is seeking a talented, innovative, passionate¬†Data Analyst to join our growing and successful Group Marketing Team, reporting to the Group Head of Web development & Analytics.

Verisure is building a talented and passionate Digital Marketing Team, and the Data Analyst position is key to its success! This is your chance to visibly impact on Verisure‚Äôs growth and the development of a best-in-class organization.

The role‚Äôs relevance in data collection and analysis is a great opportunity for a strong talent to develop our organization‚Äôs growth. Our success depends on our people, and we invest in them every day. Working with Verisure is being part of an industry leading, world-class company that thrives on a strong entrepreneurial spirit.

Key Responsibilities

As a core member of the Group Digital Marketing team, the Data Analyst will play a crucial role in driving data-informed decision-making by performing the following responsibilities:

Improving the quality and consistency of digital marketing tracking, collaborating with technical teams to maintain a robust data infrastructure and ensure the integrity of analytics data.
Designing, building, and maintaining marketing performance dashboards and reports using Tableau, Looker Studio or similar data visualization tools, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and usability for diverse stakeholders.
Engaging with cross-functional stakeholders to understand business needs, translate them into data requirements, and deliver actionable insights through compelling analysis and visual storytelling.
Partnering with teams across the organization, including Product, CRM, and Web, to identify data opportunities, support campaign measurement, and foster a data-driven culture.
Extracting and manipulating data using SQL to support advanced analytics and reporting needs.
Contributing to the development and lifecycle of Adtech products, including participation in requirement definition, data architecture design, and ongoing maintenance.

Location

The position will be based in Madrid (Spain).

Candidate profile

Qualifications, Experiences, and Competencies

Required Qualifications

Education & Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Marketing, or a related field.
Minimum of 2‚Äì3 years of experience in data analysis within a digital marketing or Adtech environment.
Experience working in multinational or cross-market teams is a plus.

Technical Skills

Good understanding of digital tracking technologies, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and custom event tracking.
Solid experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker Studio.
Familiarity with digital marketing platforms (e.g. Google Ads, Meta Ads, DV360, etc.).
Knowledge of marketing KPIs, attribution models, customer journey analysis, and performance measurement.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, cleaning, and manipulation across large datasets.
Ability to handle large datasets and navigate data warehouse environments (experience with BigQuery is a plus).
Basic understanding of Python or R for automation and exploratory data analysis is an advantage.

Analytical & Business Acumen

Strong ability to translate business problems into analytical questions and deliver actionable insights.
Working knowledge of conversion funnel analysis, CRO strategies, and campaign optimization.
Experience with A/B testing design, analysis, and interpretation is a plus.

Communication & Collaboration

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, CRM, Design, and Content.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced environment.

Languages

Fluent English is required (written and spoken).
Other languages (e.g. Spanish, French, German, or Nordic languages) are a plus.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience working with Google BigQuery or similar cloud-based data platforms.
Exposure to Adtech environments, CDPs (Customer Data Platforms), or server-side tracking.
Experience with automated reporting solutions or building data pipelines.
Familiarity with marketing mix modeling, predictive analytics, or machine learning use cases.
Certifications such as:
Google Analytics Certification
Tableau/Power BI certifications
Meta or Google Ads certifications

Strong fit with our Company DNA

Passionate in Everything We Do: Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly.¬†

Committed to Making a Difference: When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline.¬†

Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it‚Äôs a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously.¬†

Winning as a Team: Our people know that by leveraging one another‚Äôs strengths, investing in and developing our team‚Äôs capability and by collaborating well, we will win.

With Trust & Responsibility: Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.

The Company

Verisure is the leading European provider of professionally monitored security systems with 24/7 response services. We protect more than 5 million families and small businesses across 17 countries in Europe and Latin America. And our mission is to provide our customers peace of mind by protecting what matters most to them.

With over 35 years of insight, experience, and innovation, Verisure is known for category-creating marketing, sales excellence, innovative products and services, and customer-centricity. Thanks to a strong focus on high quality, our customers are amongst the most satisfied and loyal in our industry. We have some of the strongest double-digit growth and retention rates globally in consumer-facing services which demonstrates our exceptional service levels and strong value proposition to our customers.

Diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging at Verisure

At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative. We reject all forms of discrimination and bias, and we believe in access to opportunities for everyone, regardless of gender, age, disability status, race, sexual orientation, or any other status. Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging values are embedded in our company‚Äôs DNA. And we continue to prioritise our DEIB efforts every day to create a more inclusive organisation, enable diverse representation of our community, and ensure equity and meritocracy every step of the way.
¬†

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Kapsch is one of Austria's most successful global technology companies. With its comprehensive ITS (Intelligent Transportation Systems) portfolio, Kapsch is actively addressing the challenges of the present and the future with intelligent mobility solutions in a wide range of application areas. As a family-owned company founded in 1892 and headquartered in Vienna, Kapsch can look back on 130 years of experience with the future.




We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst and Data Visualization Engineer to support the development of our Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) portfolio. Our products include data and video analytics platforms for traffic management and tolling, an OCR (Optical Character Recognition) engine, and stereo vision cameras for vehicle classification. In this role, you will work with large and complex datasets to extract insights that drive innovation, optimize system performance, and inform product decisions. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams - including software engineering, AI/ML, and product management - and build dashboards to visualize key performance indicators for real-time monitoring and decision support.




Your responsibilities:

Generate actionable insights from large datasets to improve traffic and tolling solutions.
Design and build dashboards (e.g., in Qlik, Power BI) to visualize complex data and support real-time operational decisions.
Work with engineering and product teams to develop user-centric analytics features (e.g., alert systems, operator dashboards).
Analyze traffic sensor data to optimize tolling accuracy and reduce misclassification and revenue loss.
Identify patterns and trends from traffic data to support new use cases, such as congestion prediction or adaptive signaling.
Monitor AI model performance and support ongoing model retraining and customization across varying environments.
Use predictive analytics to anticipate traffic bottlenecks, optimize toll operations, and improve safety.
Support regulatory compliance by automating reporting processes and ensuring data integrity.




Required Skills & Qualifications:

Strong SQL skills and experience with relational and columnar databases.
Solid understanding of dimensional data models (star/snowflake schemas).
Experience with Python and SQL for data manipulation and extraction
Hands-on experience with Linux, Bash, Gitlab/Github, Cloud Computing
Proficiency in QLIK Sense, Power BI or similar dashboard tools.
Experience working with large datasets (‚Äúbig data‚Äù) in operational environments.
Analytical mindset and solution driven personality.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
You practice and live the agile mindset
Good oral and written English
Experience in treating with customers
Presentations skills




Nice to have:

Experience in tolling or traffic management is a plus.
Experience with traffic related models like DATEX2, SIRI, GTFS, MDS, etc.
Experience with traffic simulators like SUMO, Aimsun, PTV Vissim/Vissum




Our offer:

Pernanent role
Flexible working hours
Hybrid working model (2 days at the office/week)
30 business days of annual leave
Flexible remuneration plan
Challenging the limits of mobility for a healthy world without congestion
Adiverse and dynamic international working environment of Kapsch TrafficCom and opportunities for personal growth
Possibility to work in an international company that operates in a dynamic industry where the working environment favors the professional growth

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Business Data Analyst to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We Are

At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we‚Äôve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising ‚Ç¨250M to revolutionise digital advertising.




Your Challenge




You will get full ownership of our business data and will be expected to propose and conduct analyses that transform Seedtag‚Äôs data into significant business opportunities and KPI improvements.
You will analyse the performance of our current Contextual products and processes and proactively propose initiatives that seek to improve Seedtag‚Äôs commercial and operational results.
You will develop tools that automate internal processes, increasing the efficiency and efficacy of Seedtag teams.
You will help build tools that enable the democratisation of data inside the company and allow Seedtag teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.
Finally, you will build a solid knowledge of the adTech ecosystem and develop strong business acumen.




What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed




You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Engineering. Specific certifications/education in Data/ Business Intelligence are a plus.
You have 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment, either start-up, corporate or consulting.
You have advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
You have experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools.
You have knowledge of database management systems (e.g., BigQuery, MySQL).
You have experience working with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
You have experience in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar, and you have knowledge of Excel/ Sheets.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business value.
You have the ability to collaborate with business stakeholders to identify information needs and define business requirements.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

It would be a big plus if you

Have experience in forecasting, trend analysis, and predictive modelling.
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders.
Have experience working with Tableau.




Why Join Seedtag?




Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks




Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure?




Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!

At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst ‚Äì Barcelona (Hybrid)




We‚Äôre working with a global organisation at the forefront of innovation in human and animal health. They‚Äôre looking for a skilled Data Analyst - Backend to join their growing team in Barcelona. This is a fantastic opportunity to work in a purpose-driven environment where data plays a central role in shaping decisions that impact lives.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and implement scalable data models, with a focus on star schemas.
Build and maintain data transformation pipelines using DBT.
Work with Snowflake to manage and analyse large datasets.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business needs into actionable data insights.




What We‚Äôre Looking For:

Solid experience in a data analyst or similar role.
Strong understanding of data modelling principles.
Proficiency with DBT and Snowflake.
A collaborative mindset and strong communication skills.
Ideally based in or near Barcelona.




Why Apply?




This is a chance to join a company that:

Is privately owned and committed to long-term innovation.
Invests heavily in research and development.
Offers a supportive, international work culture with real opportunities for growth and development.




If you're looking to take the next step in your data career with a company that values both people and progress, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.




Apply now or get in touch to learn more.

Title: Junior BI Analyst
Description:
Overview: The position of Junior BI Analyst is an entry-level role. The role will include managing ad-hoc reporting/visualization tasks for production, sales, client reporting and more functions in the company.




Description:

Design & implement reports, dashboards, and visualizations using data visualization business intelligence tools
Optimize reporting dashboards with a focus on user experience, performance, flexibility, testability, and standardization
Working closely with stakeholders to understand requirements and provide the best possible solution
Make complex concepts simple and easy to understand by those around you through effective communication, planning and strategic execution
Maintain documentation for design, development and reporting work
Work within our systems and with BI team members to achieve high standards of data integrity, ensuring supporting metrics are accurate and complete
Working within team processes, data governance and security frameworks




Required Skills:

At least 1 year of experience working in a BI environment
Experience using Business Intelligence tools, such as Tableau or PowerBI
Experience in creating interactive dashboards
Minimum Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent / in the process of completing those studies.
Ability to learn new skills quickly
Ability to maintain professionalism, focus and result-orientation under pressure and tight deadlines
Attention to detail
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) in English
Exceptional problem-solving/critical thinking skills
Experience working in a corporate environment




Desired Skills:

Exposure to Knime, Request Tracker (RT), Snowflake
Prior translation industry experience
Understanding of relational databases
Fluency in a foreign language

Title: Data Analyst (Finance)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 60+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions.

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analysts who don't believe there's a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process, they never stop learning, picking up new skills, and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Supporting the Finance team in controlling market products, including market making and treasury investments
Analysing and optimising financial control and treasury management activities
Understanding business processes through financial data and ensuring accuracy from booking to accounting
Developing Price Verification Models to ensure accurate valuation of financial products
Automating financial controls to improve efficiency and compliance
Designing and implementing reconciliation logic for balance accuracy
Creating and maintaining dashboards to track key financial metrics
Collaborating with Market Making, Treasury, and Financial Control teams to enhance reporting and decision-making


What You'll Need


5+ years of experience working with Data Analysis and creating impactful solutions
Ability to manage a team and stakeholders
Excellent background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Nice to have


Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Previous experience working on a Finance department


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.


Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.


We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: AI & Data Analytics Intern
Description:
Our Group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Together with our 96.000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are committed to accelerating the transition to a carbon neutral economy through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally friendly solutions.




Are you passionate about data and looking to jumpstart your career in analytics and artificial intelligence?

Join our dynamic Madrid team as an AI & Data Analytics Intern and gain hands-on experience leveraging data to drive meaningful insights and decision-making.




Mission

This role will provide you with a comprehensive understanding of the full data lifecycle, from ETL processes to visualization, while allowing you to actively contribute to critical projects and improve existing systems.







As AI & Data Analytics intern, your main responsibilities will involve:

Documentation: Assist in documenting processes to ensure clarity and consistency across projects.
Database Normalization: Work on optimizing and structuring databases following the ENGIE Spain standards
Process Standardization: Help establish and maintain standardized workflows and procedures.
SQL Query and View Unification: Collaborate on consolidating and improving SQL queries and views for better performance and maintainability.
Full Data Stack Support: Support the entire data lifecycle, from ETL processes to dashboard development in Power BI.
Idea Generation: Actively propose and develop innovative ideas to improve processes and solutions. All suggestions will be welcomed and evaluated!




We imagine that you:

Are Data driven and interested in renewables
Enjoy handling data and tools to extract actionable insights.
Are proficiency in Python, SQL, and Power BI.
Are about to finish a top numerical degree/master (in Computer Science, Information Technology, Physics, Maths, Business Analytics, Engineering Degree, Economics or Statistics)
Are fluent in English ‚Üí C1.




Competencies required for the job position

Excellent critical thinking skills
Strong analytical & problem-solving skills
Strong time-management skills
Detail oriented and highly organized
Communication skills
Teamwork culture
Skilled in negotiation
Customer Success Oriented




Committed to inclusion

At ENGIE we value and encourage diversity and inclusion. We are committed to accelerating the transition to a carbon-neutral economy achieved by integrating exceptional and diverse individuals that seek, support, and strengthen each other‚Äôs growth.




What We Offer

Paid internships lasting 6 months to 1 year.
Full-time schedule: Monday to Thursday (full day) and Friday (reduced hours). // Summer reduced schedule from Monday to Friday during July and August.
Hybrid work model (50% remote) after the first three months.
Professional growth and future career opportunities.
A chance to gain experience in a growing and continuously evolving organization.
A dynamic, professional, and positive work environment.
Integration into a highly qualified team.
State-of-the-art office facilities.
Discounted membership for the on-site gym.
‚ÄúChill Out‚Äù zones.




ENGIE is the answer if...

- You are looking for a solid professional project with professional projection.

- You value being part of the first independent energy group in the world.

- You want to grow and develop within a dynamic and challenging company.

- If you consider that your work, together with the efforts of the people who are part of the company, can and should have a positive impact on the environment.




If you want to be part of an international group, able to offer a wide variety of jobs in a dynamic and promising sector, we are waiting for you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Embat was born to design the best way for medium and large sized enterprises to plan their finances and monitor their cash flow in real time.




We are building a financial management platform that allows them to understand what has happened in the past, track what is happening today and forecast the future of their businesses.




Our mission is to build a product that leverages technology and excellent client experience to empower our clients to make the best business decisions by accessing the best financial information, 100x more efficiently than using Excel files.




Our solution translates into savings of up to 75% of the time that financial teams spend on manual tasks. This allows them to focus on what matters most: making a greater impact within their organization and achieving a better balance between personal and professional life.




Our platform is already the trusted treasury management software of a large number of medium and large-sized corporates in Europe.




Composed of a fantastic team of people of 80+ members with different backgrounds and nationalities.




Backed by reputable international investors with the ambition to make Embat global and a great place to work! We are backed by top-tier international VCs.




In February 2024, we closed our third round of investment worth 15 million euros! This has been led by the renowned international investment fund Creandum, with the invaluable support of our partners Samaipata, 4Founders Capital, VentureFriends, Hugo Ar√©valo and Martin Blessing.




As a Data Analyst, you will join our Data team and also work closely with Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success to help scale Embat‚Äôs commercial engine through data.




We‚Äôre looking for someone with 0‚Äì2 years of experience, curious by nature, and excited about turning raw data into insights. You‚Äôll help the team track performance, identify bottlenecks, uncover opportunities, and ultimately make better, faster decisions.




We pride ourselves on working in an agile, collaborative environment, with daily interaction across teams. You‚Äôll have ownership from day one and the space to grow your skills with guidance from experienced peers.




What will you do?





Support the collection, cleaning, and transformation of data from different tools (CRM, marketing platforms, customer success platforms).


Build and maintain dashboards and performance reports related to revenue, pipeline, marketing and retention.


Execute ad-hoc analyses to solve real business problems and communicate findings clearly to stakeholders.


Contribute to improving data accuracy by identifying inconsistencies and working cross-functionally to solve them.


Help document key metrics, sources and logic used in reporting processes.


Identify and help implement process automation and self-serve reporting opportunities.


Learn how to work with business teams and translate their questions into data-driven insights.
What are we looking for?


0‚Äì2 years of experience in data-related roles


Technical background (engineering, math, physics, statistics, economics or similar). Other degrees welcome if paired with a data bootcamp or master‚Äôs.


Basic SQL and Python knowledge


You are comfortable with numbers, and have high attention to detail


You are proactive, eager to learn, and a problem-solver by nature


You enjoy working cross-functionally with teams from different backgrounds


Strong communication and structured thinking


You speak Spanish fluently and have a working level of English
What comes with working at Embat?


We offer a platform that allows you to reach your professional and personal goals.


A competitive salary according to the project and responsibility.


English Classes.


Hybrid working setup & flexible schedule.


Latest technology of your choice to do your impactful work with.


Access to private health insurance with Sanitas.


Access to salary on demand, restaurante card, transport card, and kindergarten checks through Payflow.


Career progression - Twice-yearly performance reviews.


An opportunity to work hand in hand with our founders who built their careers in Investment Banking at J.P. Morgan for more than a decade


Team Buildings plans

  • We offer a platform that allows you to reach your professional and personal goals.

  • A competitive salary according to the project and responsibility.

  • English Classes.

  • Hybrid working setup & flexible schedule.

  • Latest technology of your choice to do your impactful work with.

  • Access to private health insurance with Sanitas.

  • Access to salary on demand, restaurante card, transport card, and kindergarten checks through Payflow.

  • Career progression - Twice-yearly performance reviews.

  • An opportunity to work hand in hand with our founders who built their careers in Investment Banking at J.P. Morgan for more than a decade

  • Team Buildings plans

Title: Analista de datos
HTML:
About The Job Analista De Datos

Estamos reclutando un analista de datos (h/m) para reforzar nuestro equipo en Madrid con trabajo presencial.

Lo Que Buscamos

  • 8 a√±os (m√≠nimo) de experiencia en TI como analista de datos;
  • Experiencia en proyectos de inteligencia empresarial;
  • Experiencia en dise√±o de modelos de almac√©n de datos;
  • Experiencia en desarrollo de informes visuales y paneles de indicadores clave de rendimiento con la herramienta de inteligencia empresarial Microstrategy;
  • Experiencia en la creaci√≥n de dossiers Microstrategy;
  • Certificaci√≥n de analista de Microstrategy (obligatorio).Ôªø

Lo Que Tenemos Para Ofrecer

  • Flexibilidad en el r√©gimen de trabajo (presencial);
  • Oportunidad de crecimiento profesional en una empresa en crecimiento;
  • Ambiente de trabajo colaborativo y de apoyo;
  • Paquete competitivo de beneficios.

Si te identificas con este perfil, env√≠anos tu CV actualizado a recrutamento@movilges.com.

Si Deseas Obtener M√°s Informaci√≥n Sobre Nosotros

El Grupo Movilges cuenta con m√°s de 30 a√±os de experiencia en el mercado espa√±ol y portugues, especializada en Log√≠stica, Movilidad y soluciones IT. Ofrecemos servicios de consultor√≠a, desarrollo de aplicaciones y mantenimiento de sistemas. Al igual que el universo tecnol√≥gico, en constante evoluci√≥n, el Grupo Movilges busca evolucionar, aumentando su presencia en Portugal con Movilges IT Consulting, ofreciendo productos y servicios para la gesti√≥n completa en el √°mbito IT, desde la Consultor√≠a y el Gobierno, el desarrollo de aplicaciones con tecnolog√≠a low-code, el aseguramiento de la calidad software, hasta la automatizaci√≥n de pruebas y de procesos en Movilser Tech.

En Iberia, estamos presentes en diversos sectores, como retail, tecnolog√≠a, salud, administraci√≥n p√∫blica, energ√≠a, servicios, banca y seguros.

Al enviarnos tu candidatura, autorizas al Grupo Movilges a procesar tus datos personales, como nombre, correo electr√≥nico, n√∫mero de contacto e informaci√≥n sobre tus experiencias acad√©micas y profesionales que constan en tu CV. El procesamiento de estos datos se realiza √∫nicamente con fines leg√≠timos de la empresa, es decir, para los procesos de reclutamiento de profesionales cualificados para nuestro equipo. Si tienes alguna pregunta relacionada con tus datos personales, puedes contactarnos a trav√©s del correo electr√≥nico portugal@movilges.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¬°Hi! ¬°We are Cheil Spain! üöÄ




Cheil Worldwide is a full-service agency from brand building to digital transformations creating excellent data-driven experiences for every customer. As part of Cheil Worldwide, Cheil Spain plays its part in one of the world‚Äôs biggest agency networks ‚Äì comprising 53 offices and 8 affiliates in 43 countries globally with more than 6.000 employees and 600 clients around the world. Cheil Spain is made up of 100 employees from different disciplines, who are passionate about innovation in all its forms. We offer a wide variety of marketing and advertising services, including strategy and planning, creative, content production, traditional and digital media advertising, influencer marketing, event marketing, e-commerce and performance marketing, among others.




‚úîÔ∏è Your role at Cheil: Data Analyst




‚úîÔ∏è What we are looking for?




We are looking for a highly analytical and business-driven Senior Data Analyst to join our Performance team at Cheil Spain. This role will play a critical part in unlocking insights from web and CRM data to improve user experiences, increase conversions, and inform strategic decisions for Samsung Spain and Portugal.

The ideal candidate has strong expertise in Adobe Analytics and GA4, and a solid understanding of user behavior analysis, segmentation, and digital marketing KPIs. Bonus if you're familiar with SQL, Python, BigQuery, and Qlik.




‚úîÔ∏è Key Responsibilities:




Support CRM and performance initiatives through audience segmentation, behavior analysis, and campaign performance reporting.
Evaluate Campaigns, promotions, marketing channels attribution, the funnel, and much more for the understanding of the customer journey, identifying insights with clear business recommendations
Analyze user journeys and web behavior through Adobe Analytics and GA4 to identify performance trends, drop-offs, and optimization opportunities.
Create dashboards and reports using tools such as Adobe Workspace, Looker Studio, or Power BI to track performance and support internal and client decision-making.
Collaborate closely with UX, CRO, Paid Media, and CRM teams to align data strategies and contribute with actionable insights.
Define KPIs and measurement frameworks for digital marketing initiatives and validate technical tracking implementations (with support from GTM specialists if needed).
Deliver recurring and ad hoc reports for always-on and campaign-based activities, including funnel analysis, campaign attribution, and ecommerce performance.
Present insights clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, connecting data findings with business objectives.
Continuously monitor data quality, track implementation, and propose process improvements to strengthen data-driven decision-making.




‚úîÔ∏è Key Skills & requirements:




4+ years in a Digital Data Analyst role, ideally within an agency or ecommerce environment.
Advanced expertise in Adobe Analytics and Google Analytics 4.
Proven ability to extract, visualize, and present insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience building dashboards and reports using Looker Studio or Power BI.
Strong understanding of digital marketing campaigns, ecommerce KPIs, and data quality validation.
Excellent storytelling and presentation skills in PowerPoint.
Strong communication and teamwork skills, with a strategic business mindset.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with SQL, BigQuery, and Python for data querying and automation tasks.
Understanding of website tagging and event tracking via Google Tag Manager.
Knowledge of Adobe Audience Manager or other CDP tools.
Previous exposure to e-commerce platforms and CRO/UX concepts.
Familiarity with A/B testing frameworks and marketing attribution models.
Fluent in Spanish and English.




Languages:

C1 level of English required, with advanced English writing skills and the ability to communicate effectively with international teams and external suppliers.




‚úîÔ∏è We would like you to bring together attitudes that have to do with...




Working effectively with individuals of diverse cultures, interpersonal styles, abilities, motivations, or backgrounds.
Making the most effective use of the capabilities, insights, and ideas of all individuals.
Inspiring others by generating innovative solutions in work situations .
Trying different and novel ways to deal with work problems and opportunities.
Working effectively and cooperatively with others.
Establishing and maintaining good working relationships.
Setting high goals for personal and group accomplishment.
Tenaciously working to meet or exceed goals by proactively confronting difficult issues.
Establishing and sustaining trusting relationships by accurately perceiving and interpreting one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô emotions and behavior.
Leveraging insights to effectively manage one‚Äôs own responses and reactions.




‚úîÔ∏è Cheil offers you:




üå±Work in a growing environment, focused on creating and innovating with multidisciplinary and multicultural teams in Creativity, Digital Performance, Retail, Data and Technology.

‚úçÔ∏èStable position: Permanent contract because we want you to be part of Cheil and be able to develop with us.

üí∏Salary: To be negotiated based on experience. Bonus Performance.

üìñInternal training opportunities.

‚ù§Ô∏èSocial Benefits: Restaurant Tickets and Medical Insurance.

üïõTimetable from Monday to Thursday from 09.00-18.15 and Fridays from 09.00-15.00. July and August, we have an intensive working day, Monday to Friday from 8:00 - 15:00.

üíªHybrid working model.

üèñÔ∏è22 days of annual leave, plus 24 and 31 December and Advertising Day.

üí∞Possibility of incentive for attracting new clients and new employees to Cheil. Help us to keep growing!

üìçWe are located in Alcobendas and we have a direct bus service, 100% free, with departures from Plaza Castilla, Chamart√≠n and Nuevos Ministerios to our offices.




‚úîÔ∏è Next steps:




Are you motivated by what you have just read? Join Cheil!

If you are passionate about the world of advertising and have experience leading teams, we invite you to send your CV and cover letter. We hope to have a high-level professional who will help us continue to grow in the market.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That‚Äôs why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years‚Äô experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers‚Äô decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values


Inclusive ‚Äì we succeed together
Trusting ‚Äì we choose to trust each other
Customer committed ‚Äì we put customers at the heart of our decisions
Future Focused ‚Äì we accelerate change
Curious ‚Äì we turn knowledge into action


Role Purpose

The Data Analyst will play a key role in advancing forecasting and modelling efforts by managing, analysing, and optimising large datasets across renewable, conventional, and storage assets globally. Working on asset revenue forecasting, power dispatch modelling, or power markets data, the analyst will focus on automating workflows, ensuring data quality, and delivering actionable insights through close collaboration with research, engineering, and product teams. This role contributes directly to improving forecasting accuracy and enhancing the company's global asset performance and revenue strategies.

Responsibilities

Knowledge


Structures poorly defined problems, gathers feedback, and solves them effectively.
Defines hypotheses and appropriate analysis approaches.
Ensures statistical validity of results while avoiding common pitfalls.
Develops deep technical expertise and emerging domain knowledge in forecasting or dispatch modelling.
Provides specialist skills in data analysis, visualisation, and data management.
Fully understands the technical data landscape within the energy domain.
Maintains a growth mindset, continually evolving their skills.


Impact


Performs defined and repeatable tasks with limited guidance.
Independently formulates new analyses and project components.
Carries out independent analysis on specific areas of forecasting or modelling projects.
Delivers high-quality outputs on time, recognised for accuracy and reliability.
Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL or Python for data handling.


Collaboration


Supports data governance and quality assurance activities.
Engages directly with stakeholders, building confidence in data-driven outcomes.
Works closely with peers in Research, Product, Data, Data Engineering, and other business functions.


Innovation


Identifies opportunities for efficiency, optimisation, or new data creation within their focus area.
Uses technical and domain knowledge to create new value and insights.


Specialisms

General


Owns and manages data within their role or team focus.
Leverages specialist toolsets or domain expertise for data analysis and decision-making.


Data Modelling


Applies best practices in data modelling to support use cases.
Translates data requirements into effective data structures.
Collaborates with engineers to enhance data modelling capabilities for large-scale datasets.


Key Expectations

Experience & Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
2‚Äì4 years of experience in data analysis, including handling large, complex datasets.
Advanced SQL skills for querying and managing relational databases.
Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Sisense, Power BI, Streamlit).


Technical Skills


Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration.
Understanding of statistical methods and data modelling techniques.
Familiarity with cloud platforms like Snowflake is advantageous.
Knowledge of data governance frameworks and data security protocols.


Soft Skills


Exceptional attention to detail and problem-solving capabilities.
Strong communication skills, able to translate complex insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborative mindset with a commitment to continuous learning and staying updated on energy sector trends.


Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That‚Äôs why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years‚Äô experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers‚Äô decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values

  • Inclusive ‚Äì we succeed together
  • Trusting ‚Äì we choose to trust each other
  • Customer committed ‚Äì we put customers at the heart of our decisions
  • Future Focused ‚Äì we accelerate change
  • Curious ‚Äì we turn knowledge into action

Role Purpose

The Data Analyst will play a key role in advancing forecasting and modelling efforts by managing, analysing, and optimising large datasets across renewable, conventional, and storage assets globally. Working on asset revenue forecasting, power dispatch modelling, or power markets data, the analyst will focus on automating workflows, ensuring data quality, and delivering actionable insights through close collaboration with research, engineering, and product teams. This role contributes directly to improving forecasting accuracy and enhancing the company's global asset performance and revenue strategies.

Responsibilities

Knowledge

  • Structures poorly defined problems, gathers feedback, and solves them effectively.
  • Defines hypotheses and appropriate analysis approaches.
  • Ensures statistical validity of results while avoiding common pitfalls.
  • Develops deep technical expertise and emerging domain knowledge in forecasting or dispatch modelling.
  • Provides specialist skills in data analysis, visualisation, and data management.
  • Fully understands the technical data landscape within the energy domain.
  • Maintains a growth mindset, continually evolving their skills.

Impact

  • Performs defined and repeatable tasks with limited guidance.
  • Independently formulates new analyses and project components.
  • Carries out independent analysis on specific areas of forecasting or modelling projects.
  • Delivers high-quality outputs on time, recognised for accuracy and reliability.
  • Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL or Python for data handling.

Collaboration

  • Supports data governance and quality assurance activities.
  • Engages directly with stakeholders, building confidence in data-driven outcomes.
  • Works closely with peers in Research, Product, Data, Data Engineering, and other business functions.

Innovation

  • Identifies opportunities for efficiency, optimisation, or new data creation within their focus area.
  • Uses technical and domain knowledge to create new value and insights.

Specialisms

General

  • Owns and manages data within their role or team focus.
  • Leverages specialist toolsets or domain expertise for data analysis and decision-making.

Data Modelling

  • Applies best practices in data modelling to support use cases.
  • Translates data requirements into effective data structures.
  • Collaborates with engineers to enhance data modelling capabilities for large-scale datasets.

Key Expectations

Experience & Qualifications

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • 2‚Äì4 years of experience in data analysis, including handling large, complex datasets.
  • Advanced SQL skills for querying and managing relational databases.
  • Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Sisense, Power BI, Streamlit).

Technical Skills

  • Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration.
  • Understanding of statistical methods and data modelling techniques.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms like Snowflake is advantageous.
  • Knowledge of data governance frameworks and data security protocols.

Soft Skills

  • Exceptional attention to detail and problem-solving capabilities.
  • Strong communication skills, able to translate complex insights for non-technical stakeholders.
  • Collaborative mindset with a commitment to continuous learning and staying updated on energy sector trends.

Equal Opportunities

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That‚Äôs why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years‚Äô experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers‚Äô decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values


Inclusive ‚Äì we succeed together
Trusting ‚Äì we choose to trust each other
Customer committed ‚Äì we put customers at the heart of our decisions
Future Focused ‚Äì we accelerate change
Curious ‚Äì we turn knowledge into action


Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Wood Mackenzie‚Äôs Power and Renewables Data team.

This role will focus on the analysis, programmatic acquisition, and preparation of data for delivery to our customers and research teams.

Wood Mackenzie Produces Research And Data That The Energy Industry Relies On To Understand And Navigate The Energy Transition. Examples Of Products That You Will Contribute To Include


Power supply and demand long-term outlooks
Power market pricing history and long-term outlooks
Renewable technology supplier leaderboards


Responsibilities


Own the quality and delivery timeline of critical datasets
Obtain, transform, and deliver information from our databases to support industry analysis using Excel, PowerQuery, PowerBI, GraphQL, SQL, Sisense, Python, and Snowflake
Create and maintain workflows for internal stakeholders
Create and maintain data pipelines to feed customer facing products
Identify and assess opportunities for optimization of our systems, processes, and datasets
Monitor and resolve alerts in production environments to preserve the integrity of our products
Identify internal and external sources of data that will support customer needs
Collaborate with colleagues across multiple time zones and disciplines to uncover pain points, process improvements, and product requirements


About You


At least 2 years of experience in a data analyst or data engineering role
Experience working in environments reliant on SQL, Python, and Snowflake
Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration
Hands on approach to problem solving that delves into the details while maintaining the ability to succinctly propose solutions to steer management decisions
Independently completes projects given time and platform constraints
Desire to play a key role in the energy transition by delivering the data and research that catalyzes progress
Intellectual curiosity about the provenance of data and journey it makes to arrive at a destination
Passionate ownership of projects and excitement to share accomplishments with fellow Woodmackers
Preferred: Experience in the energy industry or power modelling domain
Fluent in English. Bonus language skills: Mandarin, Spanish


Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

Title: ANALISTA DE DATOS (M/H/X)
Description:
At Air Liquide Healthcare Iberia, we are specialists in the manufacture and comercialization of medical and healthcare gases. We manufacture and supply medical gases; we develop, install, maintain equipment and propose essential solutions for their proper use.

We work with the highest safety standards in all our processes to ensure the proper use and handling of our gases, services and equipment at all times. In addition, we have a large team of experts and professionals who have an in-depth knowledge of our customers' needs.

How will you CONTRIBUTE and GROW?

La misi√≥n de este rol es transformar el dato en un activo estrat√©gico, liderando la identificaci√≥n de valor y la automatizaci√≥n de flujos de trabajo con soluciones de Data Science e Inteligencia Artificial para optimizar las operaciones diarias.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:

Experienced Data Analyst with background in Commercial Operations or Sales, and/or Finance leveraging data analytics techniques to analyze and interpret complex data sets. This role will focus on leveraging data analytics techniques to analyze and interpret complex data sets, providing critical insights for strategic decision-making. The successful candidate will develop pipelines for automated reporting and deliver actionable insights that drive business decisions. Strong communication and collaboration skills are essential to work effectively with various stakeholders across the organization, driving data-driven initiatives that support business objectives.

Supporting the Commercial Operations, Sales and Offering teams in all areas of the day-to-day functions. This will include support in the preparation of reports, trends analysis and tracking strategic metrics. The position will also require strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with different stakeholders across the organization, driving workstreams and initiatives that support business objectives.

Required Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities


High proficiency with data analysis tools such as SQL and Python, is required. Experience with data visualization tools is an advantage (e.g., PowerBI).
Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with others in and across the organization. Ability to communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders clearly and concisely.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Ability to be self-directed, prioritize opportunities, and perform multiple tasks.
Experience with databases (SQL), data pipeline development and maintenance.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically about data and its implications. Ability to identify opportunities for process improvements and recommend changes.
Ability to derive insights from data and convert them into meaningful information. Experience with statistical analysis and data modeling techniques is an advantage.


Responsibilities


Supports Commercial Operations activities with:
Data Analysis and Insights. Analyze datasets to identify patterns, correlations, and insights that inform strategic decisions. Create and present data-driven reports and dashboards that track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and other strategic metrics.
Data Management and Automation. Design and maintain data models and data pipelines to ensure efficient collection, storage, and retrieval of data.
Reporting and Business Intelligence. Works with Business Intelligence (BI) engineers to automate reporting processes and improve data accessibility.
Collaboration and Communication. Work closely with managers in Commercial Operations, Finance and other strategic areas to support data-driven decision-making processes.


Minimum Required Education And Experience


Strong academic record, advanced degree in Business, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field preferred.
Experience in analytics engineering/data science/data analysis‚Äì focused on Sales, Finance or related area of work.
Strong analytical skills, with experience in ERP & CRM tools (SAP, Hyperion, Oracle & Salesforce).
Experience delivering data-driven projects, reports, presentations, and analysis. Experience with setting up automated pipelines is desired.
Experience in Pharmaceutical and/or Medical Devices, is desirable


IQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights, and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create intelligent connections to accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments to help improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com.

At IQVIA, we believe that diversity, inclusion, and belonging empower our mission to accelerate innovation for a healthier world. We create a culture of belonging by valuing the perspectives of all talented employees worldwide and providing them with the opportunity to power smarter healthcare for everyone, everywhere. When our talented employees bring their authentic selves and their diverse experiences to work, they enable us to accomplish extraordinary things. Multifaceted thought processes spark innovation. Multi-talented collaboration harnesses innovation to deliver superior outcomes.
