Title: Sr Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Join Embark on our mission to bring joy to dog lovers by offering the world‚Äôs best products and services to strengthen their bonds with the dogs in their lives. Our canine DNA test ‚Äî named the best by The New York Times ‚Äî enables us to make scientific advances in personalized pet care.

Designed by world leaders in dog genetics (in partnership with Cornell University), the Embark Dog DNA Test provides information on genetic health risks and breed make-up, allowing dog owners, breeders, and veterinarians to drive personalized care plans based on a dog's unique genetic profile.

Join our pack! At Embark, our People First culture is centered around building an amazing team and giving everyone an opportunity to have a voice and make an impact. We are looking for highly motivated and mission-driven employees who will join us as Embark leads the cutting edge of creativity and innovation in the fast-growing consumer genetics space.

About The Role

This role is the lead analyst sitting inside of one of our functional teams, marketing or product, executing best-in-class measurement, analytics and modelling initiatives to drive growth across the organization. Leveraging your analytical and business experience, you could find yourself measuring marketing halo impact, business development effectiveness, product performance, and organizational operational health - collaborating across all business functions to drive a data-first culture.

What you‚Äôll do


Solve a wide variety of complex analytical challenges across all functions, dynamically balancing multiple engagements
Execute end-to-end data projects from conceptualization through to deployment, working with stakeholders to optimize for scalability, performance, and reliability to address specific business challenges and objectives
Conduct exploratory statistical analysis to investigate ad hoc questions and address anomalous data
Analytical needs can include: data aggregation and creation, data cleaning and manipulation, predictive modeling, and visualizations
Leveraging technical models, guide stakeholders through the interpretation of results and the integration of actionable insights into their business workflows
Provide technical expertise and thought leadership on developing analytical tools and proprietary data assets, and oversee building these areas directly
Foster a data-first culture organizationally by developing educational materials and leading training and upskilling across the organization to ensure all stakeholders are aware of all of our most current capabilities (software, tools, data analysis techniques, etc.)
Maintain critical organizational dashboards using visualization best practices, and understanding when alternative platforms are recommended to balance priorities and target timelines


Experience we‚Äôre looking for


Minimum 5 years of experience in an analytical role within a DTC organization (startup experience preferred)
Has worked closely with different functions within an organization as the Analytics expert (Marketing, Business Development, Engineering, Product, or Science) with a strong business acumen; able to speak the language of each unique function for seamless collaboration
Proven history of proactively driving actionable insights across multiple functions of organizations that resulted in measurable positive outcomes, and continuous iteration on those projects
Proficiency in exploratory data analysis and creative problem-solving for dataset collection and performance estimation in the absence of labeled data
Deep understanding of cloud services, architecture, and scalable solutions required in cloud environments, specifically AWS
Prior experience with Tableau required, Metabase (or equivalent), and experience with web analytics tools (ex. Heap, Google Analytics, or Adobe)
Fluency with common analytical toolsets including Python, R, SQL, etc., and is able to educate others as needed
Ability to influence others within fast-growing environments towards data-driven decision making via excellent presentation skills (both written and oral); able to translate complex analytical concepts into accessible insights for various business stakeholders and executives


Why join the pack!

At Embark, we might be dog lovers, but we‚Äôre passionate about people too. We‚Äôre committed to building an inclusive culture where all employees can thrive. Here are some of our benefits and perks:


Flexible vacation policy ‚Äì take the time you need, when you need it.
Paid parental leave ‚Äì plus paw-ternity leave for new pet parents!
Every other Friday off in the summer ‚Äì enjoy those long weekends.
Subsidized pet insurance ‚Äì because our pets are family.
Big-company benefits with a startup feel ‚Äì including a 401k match, generous bonus structure, commuter benefits, and premium healthcare.
Competitive salaries and stock options ‚Äì be an owner in what we‚Äôre building.
New MacBook Pros or Windows devices ‚Äì the tools you need to succeed.
Continuing education support ‚Äì conferences, learning resources, and career growth opportunities.


Salary: $110,000 - $160,000, depending on experience and qualifications

Embark is an equal opportunity workplace and values diversity at our company. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, sexual orientation, age, disability status, marital status, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by federal, state or local laws. See also EEO is the Law.

  • Fluency with common analytical toolsets including Python, R, SQL, etc., and is able to educate others as needed
  • Ability to influence others within fast-growing environments towards data-driven decision making via excellent presentation skills (both written and oral); able to translate complex analytical concepts into accessible insights for various business stakeholders and executives

Why join the pack!

At Embark, we might be dog lovers, but we‚Äôre passionate about people too. We‚Äôre committed to building an inclusive culture where all employees can thrive. Here are some of our benefits and perks:

  • Flexible vacation policy ‚Äì take the time you need, when you need it.
  • Paid parental leave ‚Äì plus paw-ternity leave for new pet parents!
  • Every other Friday off in the summer ‚Äì enjoy those long weekends.
  • Subsidized pet insurance ‚Äì because our pets are family.
  • Big-company benefits with a startup feel ‚Äì including a 401k match, generous bonus structure, commuter benefits, and premium healthcare.
  • Competitive salaries and stock options ‚Äì be an owner in what we‚Äôre building.
  • New MacBook Pros or Windows devices ‚Äì the tools you need to succeed.
  • Continuing education support ‚Äì conferences, learning resources, and career growth opportunities.

Salary: $110,000 - $160,000, depending on experience and qualifications

Embark is an equal opportunity workplace and values diversity at our company. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, sexual orientation, age, disability status, marital status, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by federal, state or local laws. See also EEO is the Law.

Title: Dispatcher
Description:
Copart, Inc. a technology leader and the premier online vehicle auction platform globally, with over 200 facilities located across the world, Copart links vehicle sellers to more than 750,000 buyers in over 190 countries. We believe in providing an unmatched experience, every day and everywhere, driven by our people, processes, and technology.

The dispatcher is responsible for the timely and accurate dispatch of sub-haulers for vehicle pick-up and delivery while providing excellent service to customers.


Outbound calls to pick-up locations.
Dispatch sub-haulers for vehicle pick-up and delivery within company timelines.
Ensure sub-haulers meet company requirements prior to dispatching.
Outbound calls to sellers.
Solicit business.
Utilize cost effective vendors to meet company budget objectives.
Educate sub-haulers on company policies and procedures.
Maintain and archive documents.
Answer phone calls.
Collect payments on member deliveries.
Comply with Safety and enforce regulations.
Print checks.
Monitor incoming documents on the fax machine.
Print reports as needed.
Manage vendor relationships.
Performs other duties as assigned.


Required Skills & Experience


Two years dispatch experience.
One year customer service skills experience.
High School Diploma or GED preferred.
Excellent customer service skills and attitude.
Excellent Communication Skills --verbal and written.
Excellent organizational skills.
Excellent time management skills.
Typing speed 45 words per minute.
Basic Ten key proficiency.
Basic Math skills.
Computer proficiency (MS Suite experience).
Ability to operate office equipment.
Multi- tasking.
Ability to work in fast paced/diverse environment.
Strong attention to detail.
Know geographical area as well as ability to read maps.
Work with minimal supervision.
Occasional Overtime as needed.
Bilingual Skill a plus.


Pay $21.05 - $23.71 per hour

Benefits Summary


Medical/Dental/Vision
401k plus a company match
ESPP - Employee Stock Purchase Plan
EAP - Employee Assistance Program (no cost to you)
Vacation & Sick pay
Paid Company Holidays
Life and AD&D Insurance
Discounts


Along With Many Other Employee Benefits.

At Copart, we are focused on harnessing the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. By embracing diverse perspectives, we open doors to innovation and unleash the full potential of our team. We are dedicated to fostering a workplace where everyone feels appreciated, included, and inspired to grow and contribute meaningfully.

Title: Junior Data Operations Analyst
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

EchoStar is reimagining the future of connectivity, offering a wide range of services from satellite television to smart home solutions. The Data and Business Operations Analyst will analyze data to provide actionable insights, support project management, and enhance operational efficiency across various teams.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Analyze data and provide actionable insights using SQL, Python, R, Tableau, and Microsoft/Google Suite

‚Ä¢ Solve problems and meet goals with advanced statistical techniques and innovative approaches

‚Ä¢ Develop recommendations for continuous improvement for field management, executives, and partners

‚Ä¢ Conduct short and long term data analyses to enhance customer experience and reduce costs

‚Ä¢ Support ad-hoc projects to drive cost savings, improve quality, and increase efficiency

‚Ä¢ Create and maintain forecasting and resource/headcount planning models supporting budgeting and variance analysis

‚Ä¢ Lead and facilitate forecasting meetings to align stakeholders and leadership on realistic and accurate operational plans

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with Supply Chain, Manufacturing and Distribution teams to develop dashboards and track KPIs

‚Ä¢ Assess business operations and analyze upstream changes' impacts on logistics and operations

‚Ä¢ Provide reports and updates to executives and partners across sites




Qualifications:




Required:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., mathematics, statistics, computer science, business analytics)

‚Ä¢ 1-3 years of experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience

‚Ä¢ Experience manipulating large datasets in a business environment required

‚Ä¢ Experience translating data to actionable insights required

‚Ä¢ Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office or Google Suite, including high level formulas and linking of files

‚Ä¢ Strong analytical and modeling skills

‚Ä¢ Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions

‚Ä¢ Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to communicate complex data clearly and concisely to executives

‚Ä¢ Embrace the Adventure; willing to take risks, try innovative approaches, be adaptable to change, and learn from failures




Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Tableau experience preferred

‚Ä¢ SQL/R/Python experience preferred

‚Ä¢ Prior experience in Supply Chain is a plus




Company:

EchoStar Corporation (NASDAQ: SATS) is a premier global provider of satellite communication solutions. Founded in 1980, the company is headquartered in Englewood, Colorado, USA, with a team of 1001-5000 employees. The company is currently Public Company.

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
The HP Personalization & Industrial Business (PIB) offers an integrated portfolio of Services that enables predictable printing operations and optimized cost structure. It allows our customers to maximize press uptime, increase productivity, and grow their business.

The EMEA Competency Center is part of this organization, and our focus is to give support to our customers and help them to grow.

Our team actually giving support to the local service teams that are delivering onsite support to the HP Indigo customers. As part of our responsibilities we need to ensure that the knowledge is transferred from GBU to the local service teams. From our team we develop and deliver programs to help customer growth and improve current processes in the organization.

Responsibilities


Usage of different platforms to manage Data.
Creation of automatic reports to extract data that supports the organization in their operations and decisions
Creation of Dashboard in different platforms (Power BI, Tableau, Service Now) to cover the needs of the organization.


Education, Skills And Experience Required


Last year of Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science and Engineering
Fluent English.
Good presentation skills
Understanding of the printing industry
Office 365 expertise
Customer oriented
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in language to be supported.
Experience in troubleshooting in a technical environment.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.
Software and hardware knowledge of computing, storage and peripheral devices.
Advanced proficiency with case management databases and tools.
Superior customer service skills.
LEAN knowledge (preferred)
Analytical thinking and problem solving skills.
Software and hardware knowledge of computing, storage and peripheral devices.


What We Offer


Curricular Internship agreement between university, company, student
Flexible schedule for part time (4h/day) or full time (8h/day) for a 3 to12 months agreement
A Young employee Network (YEN) which host fun events on a regular basis; such as ‚Äúbeer bust‚Äù Fridays at different venues including the beach in the summertime.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy and general health
Free daily printing Happy hour ‚Äì from photographs, to large posters. And Hands-on workshops to print with the latest technology ‚Äì from wall covers to 3D printed models

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Ecolab Company has an opening for an Data Analyst Trainee in our Procurement Analytics and Digital Solutions (ADS) team located in Barcelona, Spain. If you are a passionate professional that is seeking opportunity, advancement, and a rewarding learning chance and career we invite you to apply. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly recognized global growth company offering competitive compensation and benefits in addition to career growth.

Job Overview

As a part of the Data Operations team in the Global Supply Chain Analytics and Digital Solutions group you will be responsible for continuous improvements in digital capabilities and advanced analytics. You will lead the development of new digital products providing critical insights that help solve business challenges. The successful candidate will lead efforts to improve the chemical data understanding across the organization through improved process, governance, and data management.

Candidates must display a passion for systems, data, operational reporting & advanced analytics. The strong performer can expect further career advancement opportunities with Ecolab and will have the chance to move into other roles within Procurement or the organization, with increasing leadership opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career with a stable growing company!

Main Responsibilities


Serve as a liaison among stakeholders to analyze, document, and validate requirements for reporting and changes to business processes
Develop and maintain data products
Develop, test, and operationalize new standardized reporting
Develop and maintain business intelligence dashboards
Lead automation of processes and analyses
Train other teams in systems, tools, and processes owned by ADS
Proactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through new business intelligence reporting
Interface with IT to specify and implement improvements to our data pipelines


Basic Qualifications


Masters in Data Science or Statistics or Computer Science or equivalent advance degree.
Interest in an Artificial Intelligence (AI) and business intelligence (BI) role
Experience with AI and BI data modeling and presenting insights to key stakeholders.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficient in Python, PySpark, SQL, Azure AI, Tenserflow, Streamlit, Flask, Power Apps, Power BI, Snowflake, Azure SQL Database.
Intermediate SQL skills, or willingness to learn.
Fluent English
Full-time availability.
To be eligible for the Traineeship contract you must have completed your bachelor's or master's degree studies.
Work permit in Barcelona.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience designing and building standard reports and dashboards
History of managing and delivering projects, tasks, and initiatives
Ability to create, implement, document, and continuously improve processes in a changing environment
Training or experience in data science areas such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysis
Experience with data analytics tools such as Python, R, SPSS, MATLAB, Stata, and SAS
Experience working with global cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical expertise
Microsoft PowerBI experience
Project management experience
Experience in the petrochemical industry a plus
Enrolled in or recently completed degree with emphasis in Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering preferred


Ecolab‚Äôs commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) reflects our longstanding value of working together to integrate diverse perspectives to challenge ourselves, reach our goals and do what‚Äôs right. Disability certificate will be an asset.

Our Commitment to a Culture of Inclusion & Belonging

Ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of Equal Opportunity to Employment. We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance in all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement. Ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin,citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, or disability.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We have offices in 34 countries and are developing more than 450 projects thanks to a team of over 15,000 professionals worldwide, including more than 1,000 in our offices in Spain, highly qualified to carry out all types of projects. Since 1972, we have had an operational center in Spain, with our headquarters located in Cornell√† de Llobregat, and we also have branches in Tarragona, Madrid, Castell√≥n, A Coru√±a, Huelva, and Algeciras to provide close and high-quality service to all our clients.

If you are someone motivated by this transformation in the industry and want to develop your talent to build a more sustainable future, contact us!

We are currently seeking a Data Analyst, to join our team based in Barcelona, Spain.

About the role:


Automation of workflows using Python/Power Automate/Power BI.
Development and maintenance of Power BI dashboards for tracking Safety KPIs in Engineering and Construction Projects.
Development and maintenance of Power BI dashboards for tracking Quality KPIs in Engineering and Construction Projects.
Automation of PowerPoint presentation generation with data from Power BI dashboards.
Support in the standardization of Excel files for Engineering disciplines.



About you:

Catch this opportunity and invest in your skills development, should your profile meet these requirements.


Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
Knowledge in the use of advanced spreadsheets, such as Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, macros, etc.).
Degree in areas such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Economics, or related fields.



Languages: English

What‚Äôs next?

At Technip Energies, we prioritize internal applications and provide timely feedback to internal applicants. Our Recruiting Team screens and matches your skills, experience, and potential team fit against the role requirements. We ask for your patience as the team completes the volume of applications with a reasonable timeframe. You can check your application progress directly in PeopleConnect Recruiting.

Together, let‚Äôs be part of the solution!

Description:

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft is a global leader in gaming with teams across the world creating original and memorable gaming experiences, from Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Rainbow Six, to Just Dance and more. We believe diverse perspectives help both players and teams thrive. If you‚Äôre passionate about innovation and pushing entertainment boundaries, join our journey and help us create the unknown!

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid work model.
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).



Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender sexual orientation, age or disability status.

Title: Junior Data Analyst (They/She/He) - HQ
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: Building the largest marketplace in your city, to give access to anything in minutes. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

We are seeking a highly motivated and analytical Junior Rider Experience Analyst to join our Rider Experience team. In this role, you will play a key role in shaping the loyalty strategy for our riders. You‚Äôll be responsible for analyzing the performance of our loyalty program, designing data-driven strategies to increase engagement and retention, and optimizing initiatives that drive riders satisfaction and frequency.

THE JOURNEY


Data Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret rider experience data, including feedback, performance metrics, and operational data, to identify trends, issues, and opportunities for improvement.
Insights & Reporting: Develop comprehensive reports and dashboards that communicate key rider experience metrics and insights to stakeholders.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with operations and product teams to implement initiatives that enhance the rider experience.
Program Optimization: Define and continuously refine tier thresholds based on behavioral data, operational impact, and business goals.
Strategy & Engagement: Design and monitor quests, missions, and challenges aimed at increasing frequency, loyalty, and overall engagement.
Benchmarking: Research industry best practices and competitor strategies related to rider experience to identify new opportunities.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Bachelor's degree in Business, Data Analytics, Economics, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a similar analytical role, preferably within the logistics, e-commerce, or gig economy sectors.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python/R for data analysis).
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker Studio).
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights clearly and concisely to diverse audiences.
Proactive, self-starter with a strong sense of ownership and accountability.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.


Nice To Have


Experience with rider-facing platforms or applications.
Knowledge of qualitative research methods.
Experience in A/B testing and experimentation.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Description -

The HP Personalization & Industrial Business (PIB) offers an integrated portfolio of Services that enables predictable printing operations and optimized cost structure. It allows our customers to maximize press uptime, increase productivity, and grow their business.

The EMEA Competency Center is part of this organization, and our focus is to give support to our customers and help them to grow.

Our team actually giving support to the local service teams that are delivering onsite support to the HP Indigo customers. As part of our responsibilities we need to ensure that the knowledge is transferred from GBU to the local service teams. From our team we develop and deliver programs to help customer growth and improve current processes in the organization.

Responsibilities


Usage of different platforms to manage Data.
Creation of automatic reports to extract data that supports the organization in their operations and decisions
Creation of Dashboard in different platforms (Power BI, Tableau, Service Now) to cover the needs of the organization.


Education, Skills And Experience Required


Last year of Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science and Engineering
Fluent English.
Good presentation skills
Understanding of the printing industry
Office 365 expertise
Customer oriented
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in language to be supported.
Experience in troubleshooting in a technical environment.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.
Software and hardware knowledge of computing, storage and peripheral devices.
Advanced proficiency with case management databases and tools.
Superior customer service skills.
LEAN knowledge (preferred)
Analytical thinking and problem solving skills.
Software and hardware knowledge of computing, storage and peripheral devices.


What We Offer


Curricular Internship agreement between university, company, student
Flexible schedule for part time (4h/day) or full time (8h/day) for a 3 to12 months agreement
A Young employee Network (YEN) which host fun events on a regular basis; such as ‚Äúbeer bust‚Äù Fridays at different venues including the beach in the summertime.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy and general health
Free daily printing Happy hour ‚Äì from photographs, to large posters. And Hands-on workshops to print with the latest technology ‚Äì from wall covers to 3D printed models

Title: Data Analyst Junior- Control Tower
Description:
Description

The EU External Fulfilment (EF) network consists of circa 35 operations which offer flexible solutions to the CF network operated by external providers (3PL providers). EU EF primarily provides: (1) network capacity solutions (storage/throughput), (2) special operation solutions (Hazmat, BWS, IXD, SDC, ICC, etc) and (3) emerging market penetration solutions. EU EF is currently undergoing an operational transformation, driving demand for enhanced expertise in Outbound (OB).

The goal of EU 3PL Control Tower is to provide an excellent operational end to end, 24/7 support, in 3PL buildings across European/UK External Fulfillment chain. We aim to provide the standardized and optimized process with frustration free communication. This role is for a highly driven and motivated individual with operational experience and innovative, hands-on approach.

This position involves the daily operational tasks resolutions and day to day communication with 3PL and Amazon team of problem solvers and node managers on their KPIs management.

The successful candidate will be responsible for: a- Provide reactive/proactive support to 3PL Providers and Amazon internals, b- Work on internal Projects to improve/automate 3PL Control Tower services. This person has a strong delivery record, attention to details and will be able to work independently with limited supervision.

This job involves 3PL operations monitoring and ops support, within a team that covers 24/7 shift pattern, for 30+ buildings in Europe/UK.

The shift to cover is Night Shift: 10pm CET to 6am CET, Sunday to Thursday (Friday and Saturday: days off).

Key job responsibilities


Providing the operational guidance to 3PL
Being a communication bridge between 3PL and Amazon stakeholders
Mitigating CX risk by CPT management support, resolving OB errors and managing shipment cancellations
Supporting on Transportation escalations.
Uploading critical data for supply chain and transportation visibility
Checking process and Amazon standard compliance
Optimization of actual Control Tower Outbound processes, aiming to automatize the actual tasks of the team, applying BI skills.
Work on Projects to improve actual 3PL Control Tower services, and capture new services that can be scalable to all 3PL sites.


Basic Qualifications


- Relevant experience working with the MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)
- C1 English level
- Spanish C2 level


Preferred Qualifications


High school or equivalent diploma.
Focus on details and analytical approach.
Expertise in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, AI, etc.
Experience in logistics.


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Job Summary

We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst to join a dynamic and collaborative team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing insightful dashboards, optimizing data models and pipelines, and delivering actionable business intelligence to a variety of stakeholders.

Job Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI.
Translate business requirements into effective data models and analytical solutions.
Optimize data pipelines to ensure high performance, scalability, and reliability.
Collaborate with data engineers, analysts, and business stakeholders to define and meet data needs.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and relevance across reporting solutions.
Apply best practices in data integrity, governance, and security.
Support the continuous improvement of data analytics processes and tools.
Provide actionable insights to drive strategic decision-making.
Document solutions and maintain clear communication with both technical and non-technical audiences.


Desired Skills

data governance

data quality

Azure Synapse

Azure SQL

agile environments

multi-source data integration

relocation experience

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
The Swiss-based DocMorris AG is a leading company in the fields of online pharmacy, marketplace and professional healthcare with strong brands in Germany and other European countries. With its business model, DocMorris offers its patients, customers and partners a broad range of products and services. In doing so, DocMorris is pursuing its vision of creating a digital health ecosystem for everyone to manage their health in one click.

In Spain and France, the company operates the leading marketplace for health and personal care products in Southern Europe. With an innovative business model, our marketplace does not manage stock or warehouses, it integrates the catalog of products, pricing, and stock levels of the most important and trusted off-line pharmacies in a single website, achieving 24h delivery service for more than 200.000 products and 10.000 brands from more than 1.000 pharmacies and health stores. Our business model and service have received several awards like the prize for Best Webshop in Spain as well as the Best Mobile App from the E-Commerce Awards.

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Data team, reporting to the Head of Data and working side by side with the business, finance, marketing, and engineering teams, to help extract the full value from our data in order to ask and answer questions, make decisions, and optimize, all to improve the experience for our customers and marketplace sellers by helping our internal teams with the appropriate data and reports.

Tasks and Responsibilities:


Follow-up and analysis of the main KPIs related to marketing, business, operations and finance in order to detect deviations, propose improvement actions, facilitate the decision-making process, and to detect/prevent potential loss of business faster.
Continuous development of efficient/automated reporting dashboards, tools, and processes to support decision-making.
Assisting stakeholders in the usage of the various existing systems and datasets available within the company and driving the development of new solutions.
Ad-hoc analysis to assist different teams in the decision making process, such as evaluating the performance of A/B Tests.
Prepare the monthly presentations for Business review meetings and Boards.
Support CFO, CMO, Marketing managers and SEO manager in the process of preparing the annual Budget and Rolling forecast.
Collaborate with and support the different teams inside the company, serving as the link and translator between these stakeholders and the data team, managing, clarifying, and defining their requests.


What we are looking for:


Professional Experience:
Minimum 2 year experience as a Data Analyst.
Experience in a customer-centric company, preferably e-commerce, transactional marketplace, or e-health, is a plus.
People Skills:
Excellence: in organization, planning and execution. Focus on details and ability to work under pressure and prioritize. Experience with Agile is a plus.
Proactivity: proposes new ideas and is able to work independently.
Ownership: takes on every challenge with responsibility until we find the solution. Problem solving mind-set.
Team: accustomed to collaborating with many stakeholders from multiple departments, solving problems together and sharing in achievements, failures, successes.
Highly analytical skills: obsession with data and continuous improvement.
Professional Skills:
Proficiency in the use of Excel.
Experience using a BI tool. Qlik Sense is a plus.
Good command of SQL.
Knowledge of Python or similar programming language.
Languages: Spanish and English (proficiency).
Domain knowledge (marketing, business, finance, operations, logistics) is a plus.


Our Benefits


Ticket restaurant 11‚Ç¨/day worked
25 days of holiday
Birthday day-off + 50‚Ç¨ voucher to spend on our website!
Health insurance with Sanitas is paid by PromoFarma (for those who want it!)
Social benefits package. You can dedicate a part of your gross salary to Ticket Transport or Nursery.
Opportunity to participate in the employee participation program (stock options)
10% discount on our website on each purchase and up to 30% discount on DocMorris branded products
Access to eLearning platforms such as LinkedIn Learning
Individual training opportunities and budget for personal development
Access to corporate wellness plattform "Wellhub" (ex Gympass) with various offers on gyms, studios, guided classes, workouts and wellness app
Access to mobile consultations with medical specialists, lawyers or veterinarians via "Doctor i "
Great employee events and annual company celebrations

Title: Data Analyst (Based in Spain only)
Description:
Imagine yourself‚Ä¶


Growing your expertise and expanding your skillset with every project.
Owning your ambition and fueling your career growth.
Joining a company with a proven track record of success and an exciting future.



It‚Äôs all possible with a role at Esko. Esko, a Veralto company, is a global provider of integrated software and hardware solutions that accelerate the go-to-market process of packaged goods. Our integrated platform and comprehensive tools empower retailers, pre-media and trade shops, manufacturers, and converters to manage best-in-class packaging design and print processes.

Innovation in the is built into the DNA of our business: every day, we challenge ourselves to be better by seeking out new ways to elevate our products, our processes, and our people.

We also know that innovation and ingenuity starts with prioritizing a diverse workforce and a deeply inclusive workplace. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our‚ÄØpositions.‚ÄØ

As a Data Analyst, you‚Äôll work on a variety of customer-focused data projects, driving impactful insights and solutions. This is a remote position based in Spain. Candidates based in other countries will not be considered.

In this role, a typical day will look like:


Connecting data sources ‚Äì Establish and manage reliable connections to a variety of internal and external data sources, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Transforming and preparing data ‚Äì Use SQL, Power Query, and other tools to clean, blend, and structure data for reporting and analysis.
Designing dashboards & reports ‚Äì Build intuitive, visually compelling dashboards in Power‚ÄØBI that surface key metrics and performance trends for a wide range of stakeholders.
Analyzing trends & patterns ‚Äì Drill into datasets to uncover drivers, anomalies, and opportunities that inform strategic and operational decisions.
Presenting insights ‚Äì Communicate complex findings to both technical and non‚Äëtechnical audiences through presentations, reports, and live demo sessions.
Partnering with the business ‚Äì Collaborate closely with product, operations, and commercial teams to translate business questions into analytic deliverables.
Occasional travel within Spain and across Europe to participate in workshops and meetings, fostering collaboration and aligning data initiatives with broader company goals.



The essential requirements of the job include:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Business, Economics, Data Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field.
:1 year of experience (including internships) in a Data Analyst or similar role, working with real‚Äëworld datasets.
Strong SQL skills for querying and manipulating relational databases.
Hands‚Äëon Power‚ÄØBI experience creating interactive dashboards, reports, and data models.
Experience with DAX and Power Query) to build effective analytical solutions.
Foundational statistical knowledge (e.g., distributions, hypothesis testing) and an analytical mindset.
Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain data insights clearly.



It would be great if you have:


Proficiency with Python (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib) for data manipulation and visualization.
Exposure to cloud data platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP) and version control (Git).
Knowledge of data storytelling and visualization best practices.



Esko is proud to part of the Product Quality & Innovation segment of Veralto (NYSE: VLTO), a $5B global leader dedicated to ensuring access to clean water, safe food and medicine, and trusted essential goods. When you join Veralto‚Äôs vibrant global network of 16,000 associates, you join a unique culture and work environment where purpose meets possibility: where the work you do has an everyday impact on the resources and essentials we all rely on, and where you‚Äôll have valuable opportunities to deepen your skillset, pursue your ambitions, and grow your career. Together, we‚Äôre Safeguarding the World‚Äôs Most Vital Resources‚Ñ¢‚Äîand building rewarding careers along the way.

At Veralto, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

If you‚Äôve ever wondered what‚Äôs within you, there‚Äôs no better time to find out.

Unsolicited Assistance

We do not accept unsolicited assistance from any headhunters or recruitment firms for any of our job openings. All resumes or profiles submitted by search firms to any employee at any of the Veralto companies, in any form without a valid, signed search agreement in place for the specific position, approved by Talent Acquisition, will be deemed the sole property of Veralto and its companies. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Veralto and its companies because of the unsolicited referral.

, Luz Ayus, >

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech‚Äôs invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton‚Äôs services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here!

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.

What You Will Do



Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data
Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources
Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization
Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format
Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated
Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units



Job Requirements



Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.
Strong analytical skills
Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics
at least 5 years of relevant working experience in the field
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Strong data visualization skills



Bonus points for:



Good knowledge of Python
Git knowledge
Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas



What We Offer



Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton‚Äôs only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.



Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.


Show more
HTML:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech‚Äôs invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton‚Äôs services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here!

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.

What You Will Do


  • Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data
  • Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources
  • Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization
  • Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format
  • Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated
  • Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units


Job Requirements


  • Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics
  • at least 5 years of relevant working experience in the field
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL
  • Strong data visualization skills


Bonus points for:


  • Good knowledge of Python
  • Git knowledge
  • Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas


What We Offer


  • Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
  • Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
  • Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
  • Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
  • Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
  • Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
  • Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
  • Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
  • Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton‚Äôs only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.


Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.

Title: Workplace Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

Are you passionate about data analysis and want to contribute to enhancing user experience at Allianz? Join our team as a Senior Data Analyst in the Workplace Service department, where you will play a key role in transforming data into valuable insights that guide our decisions. If you have experience in data analytics and are looking for a collaborative environment, we want to meet you

What You Do


Transform & enrich data from various data sources to draw a holistic view of service health, possible issues & weak points.
Using statistical libraries and programming to identify, analyse, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets.
Respond to data-related queries from other WPS product teams & implement them jointly.
Analyze data and visualize results using Power BI and similar technologies.
Research new ways to make use of the collected data (e.g., apply AI for pattern recognition).
Produce reports and charts communicating trends within data to non-specialists..
Support product teams for the root cause & impact analysis during incident and problem management process.
Ideate data analytics requirements together with other WPS teams with various maturity in the data analytics area.


What You Bring


At least 3 years of practical experience within data analytics with hands on experience with python.
Good understanding of modern software design and development technologies, such as data lake, containers, DevOps and knowledge of cloud services such as Azure, AWS or similar.
Strong analytical skills with ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Technical expertise, previous experience working with data models, data mining, prediction models, and segmentation techniques.
Strong knowledge of and experience with data storage (SQL, cloud storage etc), programming (python, SQL, PySpark etc.) and BI tools (Power BI etc.).
Strong knowledge of statistics and applying statistical packages for analysing datasets.
Good interpersonal and collaboration skills as well as ability to jointly work with multiple groups.
Hands on experience in creating and deploying analytical dashboard solutions including understanding of design, development, deployment, data engineering and data management practices.
Higher education degree in IT, business intelligence, or comparable education.


What We Offer


We offer a hybrid work model which recognizes the value of striking a balance between in-person collaboration and remote working incl. up to 25 days per year working from abroad.
We believe in rewarding performance and our compensation and benefits package includes a company bonus scheme, pension, employee shares program and multiple employee discounts (details vary by location).
From career development and digital learning programs to international career mobility, we offer lifelong learning for our employees worldwide and an environment where innovation, delivery and empowerment are fostered.
Flexible working, health and wellbeing offers (including healthcare and parental leave benefits) support to balance family and career and help our people return from career breaks with experience that nothing else can teach.


About Allianz Technology

With its headquarters in Munich, Germany, Allianz Technology is Allianz's global IT service provider and delivers IT solutions that drive the group's digitalization. With more than 11,000 employees in over 20 countries around the world, Allianz Technology is tasked to run, optimize, transform, and innovate the infrastructure, applications, and services together with Allianz companies to co-create the best customer experience.

We service the entire spectrum of digitalization ‚Äì from one of the industry's largest IT infrastructure projects that spans data centres, networks, and security, to application platforms ranging from workplace services to digital interaction.

In short: We deliver comprehensive end-to-end IT solutions for Allianz in the digital age. We are the backbone of Allianz.

Find us at: www.linkedin.com/company/allianz-technology.

D&I statement

Allianz Technology is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity and commits itself to creating an inclusive work environment for all.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of race, ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, social class, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.

Join us. Let¬¥s care for tomorrow.

You. IT.

To Recruitment Agencies:

Allianz Technology has an in-house recruitment team that sources great candidates directly. Therefore, Allianz Technology does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies or search firm recruiters.

When we do work with recruitment agencies, that engagement is formalized by a contract. Fees will only be paid when there is a contract in place. Without a contract in place, we will not accept invoices on unsolicited resumes, even if the candidate was ultimately employed by Allianz

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your Role

We are looking for a detail-oriented and motivated Data Analyst with at least 5 years experience to support our analytics initiatives and contribute to the delivery of data products that drive business growth.

This role will involve working closely with various business areas, including Market Analysis, Media, Promotions, CRM, and Digital Products.

As Data Analyst you‚Äôll be responsible for preparing, analyzing, and visualizing data to uncover actionable insights.

This is a great opportunity to grow in a data-driven organization while working with cutting-edge tools and gaining exposure to real-world business challenges.

What you will do


Data Preparation & Analysis:
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Support the development of reports, dashboards, and visualizations to present insights to internal stakeholders.
Ensure data quality by conducting regular audits and identifying inconsistencies or gaps.
Contribute to projects that require integrating data from different sources, including Google Cloud Platform ( BigQuery , Looker) and SAP analytics tools ( DataSphere , SAC).
Business Support :
Collaborate with teams across Marketing, Sales, and Digital to understand their data needs and provide relevant analysis.
Translate business questions into data queries and actionable insights.
Present findings in a clear and concise manner, tailoring communication to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Focus on Market, Media, and Promotions Analytics:
Support analysis of market trends, media performance, and promotional effectiveness.
Assist in calculating ROI, customer segmentation, and channel performance evaluations.
Help build and maintain dashboards that track key metrics for media, promotions, and market dynamics.
Continuous Learning & Improvement :
Stay updated on best practices in data analytics, visualization, and storytelling.
Learn and apply emerging tools and techniques, such as machine learning models or advanced statistical methods, as directed by the Senior Data Analyst.
Contribute ideas to improve existing processes, tools, and methodologies.



What we are looking for

Technical Expertise


Proficiency in data analytics tools such as Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Looker) and literacy in SAP analytics tools (DataSphere, SAC).
Experience with data visualization platforms like Power BI or Looker.
Understanding of statistical analysis and machine learning concepts.



Collaboration & Communication


Strong interpersonal skills to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams
Focus on a continuous value-delivery with an agile approach.
Ability to communicate technical findings in a clear, business-friendly manner.
Eagerness to learn from senior team members and contribute to team success.



What we offer


Hybrid working model
Flexible working hours
Ticket Restaurants
Pension plan
Fully equipped Gym
Breakfast and fresh fruit
Affinity University platform: Professional development opportunities for employees at different stages of their careers, acknowledging diverse career paths.
Pet-friendly office
Celebrations & Fun



If you don‚Äôt m eet all the requirements, don‚Äôt worry. We value diverse backgrounds and encourage you to apply anyway. Your application will be thoughtfully reviewed!

We cultivate an inclusive culture that celebrates diversity. We firmly believe that embracing a variety o f perspectives is integral to both our company‚Äôs success and the strength of our team. That‚Äôs why we are committed to providing equal opportunities for all.

Our Company

Affinity Petcare is more than an international petfood company. For more than 60 years , we have been dedicated to nourishing healthy bonds between dogs, cats, and people to make the world a better place.

We are very proud of our innovative brands which include: Ultima, Advance, Brekkies, Nature‚Äôs Variety, Nature‚Äôs Menu, Natural Trainer, Li bra, and more. Currently, we have over 1,200 professionals working for this purpose from Barcelona, Paris, Milan, and London, as well as 4 production sites through which we supply the 70+ countries where our brands have a presence.

So, what are you waiti ng for? Join our team to leave your footprint!

Want to know more about us?

Follow us on LinkedIn for the latest updates and job opportunities. You can also follow us on Instagram to learn more about life at Affinity and hear from our team.

Title: FinOps Reporting & Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are

Adevinta is undergoing a major Finance transformation, establishing a new global operating model supported by both local and centralized functions (OTC, P2P, R2R) and a global BPO partner (in Cluj and Bangalore).

As a FinOps Reporting & Data Analyst, you will play a key role in enabling data-driven decision-making by delivering accurate, insightful and timely financial reports across Finance Operations. You will partner closely with Global Process Owners to support operational performance, ensure compliance, and drive process efficiency ‚Äî especially within Order-to-Cash (OTC), Procure-to-Pay (P2P) and Record-to-Report (R2R) processes.

This is a highly analytical and business-oriented role, where understanding the underlying financial processes is just as important as strong technical reporting skills. The role can be based in Barcelona or Amsterdam, working in a hybrid model as part of an international team.

Key Responsibilities


Design and automate performance dashboards using Power BI, Tableau, or Looker for real-time visibility into OTC, P2P, and R2R metrics
Collaborate with Global Process Owners and Finance Systems teams to gather requirements and deliver impactful reporting solutions
Analyze operational and financial performance, identify risks and inefficiencies, and present actionable insights to senior stakeholders
Support compliance by ensuring reporting is aligned with internal control frameworks and external audit requirements (e.g., SOX)
Consolidate and validate data from SAP S4 and data warehouses, in collaboration with MDM analysts
Identify opportunities for automation and process improvement within financial reporting and analysis
Ensure accuracy, consistency, and audit-readiness of all reporting outputs
Support Finance transformation initiatives and continuous improvement efforts across the global FinOps function


Your Profile


7‚Äì12 years of relevant experience in Finance Operations, Shared Services, or reporting roles within multinational environments
Solid understanding of OTC, P2P and R2R process cycles and how they impact business performance
Hands-on experience with SAP S4, and familiarity with systems such as Blackline or OneStream
Advanced Excel and strong proficiency with Tableau, Power BI, or other BI/reporting tools
Familiarity with SQL and data modeling concepts is a plus
Understanding of internal control frameworks and SOX compliance
Proven ability to deliver results in a matrixed, fast-paced, and changing environment
Fluency in English is required; knowledge of other European languages (e.g., Spanish, French) is a plus


Benefits

Life at Adevinta comes with its perks! Our Adevintans enjoy the following benefits:


An attractive Base Salary üí∏
Participation in our Short-Term Incentive plan (annual bonus) üèÜ
Work From Anywhere: Enjoy up to 20 days a year of working from anywhere! Maybe not from the moonüåõwell why not! just make sure you have internet connection! üåç
A 24/7 Employee Assistance Program for you and your family, because we care ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äç
Win together, lose together is one of our key behaviours. At Adevinta you will find a collaborative environment with an opportunity to explore your potential and grow üå±


On top of these, we also provide a range of locally relevant benefits. Wanna know more? Apply and ask our recruiters! ‚ú®

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.
