Title: Senior Data Analyst - Marketing
Description:
Wallapop is a Barcelona based scale-up driven by the purpose to empower people to embrace a more conscious and human way of consumption. We believe in a world where collaborative economy is mainstream. This is what drives us. üí´

Wallapop operates in Spain, Italy and Portugal, offering a catalogue of several hundreds of millions of products and services. Powered by technical innovation and continuous improvement, we bring together the scale & trust of classifieds with the marketplace's convenience & reach. üå± Our mission is to enable a connected trade ecosystem, making 2nd-hand the norm through smart use of technology.

Backed by top investors such as Accel, Insight Partners & Naver Corp we bring our total valuation to 806 million EUR and are embarking on our international journey with the aim to become the world's best unique goods trading platform.

The Challenge üß©

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for working with large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations. You will work closely with Marketing, creating data pipelines and transforming data-driven insights into strategic recommendations. Collaborating closely with Product, Data, and Tech teams, you will design and execute experiments, conduct quantitative research, and ensure continuous access to high-quality data and insightful visualizations.

What You Will Do üëá


Extract quantitative insights from data and interpret them in order to provide the team with actionable opportunities and correctly assess knowledge gaps
Participate in the definition and implementation of the team's main metrics and data models, ensuring quality and reliability
Present and share quantitative insights and/or analysis to stakeholders across the company
Facilitate data access to stakeholders and team members
Collaborate and participate in core projects for the central Analytics in order to provide a holistic view of data in the company
Promote data culture across the team and the organization
Ensure the quality and relevance of experiments
Map qualitative insights with concrete metrics that can support findings
Provide high-quality documentation for metrics, analysis, data models, etc.
Work in the Integration and extraction of data from various data sources, transforming and loading it into a centralized data repository or data warehouse.


What We're Looking For üîé


Knowledge in programming languages such as Python and SQL.
Familiarity with data integration, ETL processes and ability to build data pipelines.
Basic knowledge of cloud-based environments, ideally AWS.
Experience with Data Warehousing and ETL processes.
Experience in developing advanced visualizations and interactive dashboards for data insights, by using BI tools such as Looker or Tableau.
Understanding of data analytics concepts, techniques and methodologies.
Strong attention to detail and a passion for problem-solving.
Great communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with domain teams and stakeholders.
Ability to learn quickly and keep up with emerging technologies in the data analytics space.


What Would Be A Plus üöÄ


Basic experience in training and applying Machine Learning models and techniques
Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).
Domain expertise in marketplaces or classifieds.
Exposure to qualitative research methodologies.


Do note that all our jobs are üìç Barcelona based. We follow a hybrid model where flexibility rules. We commit to a minimum of 6 days per month in the office. Each team self-organizes to decide on cadence and in-person/remote rituals.

Wallapop is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees as we want Wallapop to be a place for everyone.

Additionally to the opportunity to contribute to an agile product set up and work together towards achieving our meaningful mission, we offer the following üç≠ Perks & Benefits:


Competitive phantom shares package for all employees
Generous individual learning budget of 2k per year
Group and individual English, Catalan & Spanish lessons as part of our working day
Private Health Insurance with Alan
Flexible working hours + intensive Fridays
Flexible remuneration to deduct from gross salary (kindergarten/food/transport check)
Gym & Wellness plan, including physiotherapist in the office
Generous referral Program & Charity Donation
Bonus for weddings & newborns
Wallapop Renta (Tax income support)
Monthly plan for free shipping, bumps & home-pick-up on our services
Work anniversary Gifts and Birthday Surprises
Contribution towards your WIFI in your monthly payroll
One-off payment based on compensation package to go towards setting up your home office
Relocation package (monetary support and legal advice) and visa sponsorship, if applicable
26 holidays per year
TOP hardware of your choice (latest Apple or Windows)


What does the hiring process for this position look like? üëÄ**Please, note that all interviews take place remotely over hangouts.**

Intro Call - run by talent acquisition, focus on providing more information about the role and the company as well as going over your experience, motivation, and expectations. This usually takes 45-60 minutes.

Online test - you will be sent a coding test to assess your analytical skills.

Case Study Submission - you will be assigned a task to submit within 5 up to 7 days where you will be able to showcase your expertise / technical skills required for the role.

Expertise Interview - run by the hiring team, focus on the required core skills and the ability to deliver in a given context. This usually takes 60-90 minutes.

Stakeholder Interview - run by relevant stakeholders reflecting the reality of the context of the role, focus on the ability to collaborate & deliver in a cross-functional set-up. This usually takes 60 minutes.

Culture Interview - run by culture interviewers, focus on adherence to Wallapop's purpose and business proposition. This usually takes 60 minutes.

Offer - should you be the right candidate, your offer will be discussed over a call with talent acquisition and will then be confirmed in writing.

Title: Transport Master Data Analyst
Description:
Master Data Analyst (Transport)

Master Data Analyst would be part of a team, in charge of transport MD process, running enrichment processes and maintenance of master data for Coty worldwide on a global SAP platform.

Responsibilities

You would be responsible for ensuring that the Transport Master Data is created on time and accurate as per briefing from Logistics/Transport department. You are following the Global Data Standards provided by our Data Governance Team and contributing to adjust them to changing needs. As Coty‚Äôs growth builds on constant new product developments, this position plays a key role delivering ‚ÄúData Readiness‚Äù during different stages of the Innovation and leading the work across.

Your main focus:


Coordination of the daily Transport Master Data communications
Daily Transport Master Data alignment with the 4PL (new lanes, lane changes, new locations, location terminations and Data alignment)
Data gathering, alignment and validation with source data owners for creation and maintenance of lanes in the Transportation master data database (SAP cloud-BTP)
Data requests to source data owner to ensure transport master data availability
Reporting on lane data to several internal parties
Support on reporting improvements
Follow up on Data quality topics
Deliver Key Performance Indicators, making sure to reach the Service Level Agreement targets.
Root cause and log.


Working for Coty means being part of one of the largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skin care and body care. We are a global leader in fragrance and number three in color cosmetics and our products are sold in over 150 countries around the world. COTY and its brands are committed to a range of social causes, embraces diversity as well as seeking to minimize its impact on the environment. You can work in a truly international and dynamic work environment, in a culture based on trust and cooperation with opportunities of continues improvement and learning with the freedom to be yourself.

The team consists today of nine Master Data Analyst. You will work closely together with several departments such as Master Data Governance, Initiative leaders, Logistics, Planning, etc. All your colleagues are dedicated experts and ready to drive Coty to the next level. Working with a team environment with can do attitude, optimistic, focus on finding solutions. The team has a continuous improvement mindset, committed to resolving upcoming challenges and opportunities, to make processes more efficient. Master data community main characteristics are team spirit, collaboration and working together cohesively toward common goals. They willingly share knowledge and resources, help when needed, and celebrate each other's successes.

YOU ARE A COTY FIT

You like to focus on the results and be able to react to the business‚Äôs need with sensibility. As a/an experienced Master Data Analyst, you collaborate and work together with other teams, and you get energy from working in a fast-paced, diverse, and international environment.

Other than that, you:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree (Engineering, BA and/or similar academic background).
Good technical skills in Excel and SAP. Knowledge in Microsoft Access, Visual Basic will be considered.
Root Cause Analysis (RCA) mentality, with ability to propose and deliver improvements.
Team Player mindset.

Omni-Working: Hybrid flexible working model enabling employees to balance remote and office-based work and promote work / life balance.

About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. HTML:
Master Data Analyst (Transport)

Master Data Analyst would be part of a team, in charge of transport MD process, running enrichment processes and maintenance of master data for Coty worldwide on a global SAP platform.

Responsibilities

You would be responsible for ensuring that the Transport Master Data is created on time and accurate as per briefing from Logistics/Transport department. You are following the Global Data Standards provided by our Data Governance Team and contributing to adjust them to changing needs. As Coty‚Äôs growth builds on constant new product developments, this position plays a key role delivering ‚ÄúData Readiness‚Äù during different stages of the Innovation and leading the work across.

Your main focus:

  • Coordination of the daily Transport Master Data communications
  • Daily Transport Master Data alignment with the 4PL (new lanes, lane changes, new locations, location terminations and Data alignment)
  • Data gathering, alignment and validation with source data owners for creation and maintenance of lanes in the Transportation master data database (SAP cloud-BTP)
  • Data requests to source data owner to ensure transport master data availability
  • Reporting on lane data to several internal parties
  • Support on reporting improvements
  • Follow up on Data quality topics
  • Deliver Key Performance Indicators, making sure to reach the Service Level Agreement targets.
  • Root cause and log.

Working for Coty means being part of one of the largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skin care and body care. We are a global leader in fragrance and number three in color cosmetics and our products are sold in over 150 countries around the world. COTY and its brands are committed to a range of social causes, embraces diversity as well as seeking to minimize its impact on the environment. You can work in a truly international and dynamic work environment, in a culture based on trust and cooperation with opportunities of continues improvement and learning with the freedom to be yourself.

The team consists today of nine Master Data Analyst. You will work closely together with several departments such as Master Data Governance, Initiative leaders, Logistics, Planning, etc. All your colleagues are dedicated experts and ready to drive Coty to the next level. Working with a team environment with can do attitude, optimistic, focus on finding solutions. The team has a continuous improvement mindset, committed to resolving upcoming challenges and opportunities, to make processes more efficient. Master data community main characteristics are team spirit, collaboration and working together cohesively toward common goals. They willingly share knowledge and resources, help when needed, and celebrate each other's successes.

YOU ARE A COTY FIT

You like to focus on the results and be able to react to the business‚Äôs need with sensibility. As a/an experienced Master Data Analyst, you collaborate and work together with other teams, and you get energy from working in a fast-paced, diverse, and international environment.

Other than that, you:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree (Engineering, BA and/or similar academic background).
  • Good technical skills in Excel and SAP. Knowledge in Microsoft Access, Visual Basic will be considered.
  • Root Cause Analysis (RCA) mentality, with ability to propose and deliver improvements.
  • Team Player mindset.
  • Strong sense of individual accountability ‚Äì personal drive to improve and passionate ownership of performance.
  • Autonomous motivation to implement changes and challenge the current process / system to deliver improved results.
  • Good English level and communication skills.

Our Benefits

As our Master Data Analyst some of the benefits you will receive are:

  • A salary that matches your knowledge and experience
  • Omni-Working: Hybrid flexible working model enabling employees to balance remote and office-based work and promote work / life balance.
  • Flexible working hours
  • Meal voucher
  • Medical & Physiotherapy Service

RECRUITMENT PROCESS

  • A telephone/online introductory meeting.
  • A first online/in-person interview
  • A second interview
  • You will receive a proposal with the terms of employment.

About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self. Para este puesto es fundamental la comprensi√≥n del catal√°n, y valorable que lo hable, debido a un proyecto con un cliente local.

RESPONSABILIDADES

An√°lisis de Datos: Examinar grandes vol√∫menes de datos para identificar tendencias, patrones, oportunidades y problemas. Esto implica la creaci√≥n de informes, dashboards y la realizaci√≥n de an√°lisis en profundidad.
Monitorizaci√≥n del Rendimiento: Hacer un seguimiento del rendimiento de sitios web, aplicaciones, campa√±as de marketing digital (SEO, SEM, redes sociales, e-mail marketing, etc.) y otras iniciativas digitales.
Identificaci√≥n de Insights: Transformar datos brutos en insights accionables que puedan guiar la toma de decisiones estrat√©gicas para mejorar el ROI (Retorno de la Inversi√≥n).
Optimizaci√≥n: Proponer e implementar mejoras basadas en datos, como la optimizaci√≥n de los embudos de conversi√≥n, la personalizaci√≥n de contenido, mejoras en la experiencia de usuario (UX), etc.
Pruebas A/B y Optimizaci√≥n de la Tasa de Conversi√≥n (CRO): Realizar pruebas controladas para comparar diferentes versiones de p√°ginas, anuncios o elementos de dise√±o y determinar cu√°l tiene un mejor rendimiento.
Generaci√≥n de Informes: Presentar los resultados de los an√°lisis de forma clara y comprensible para diferentes stakeholders, incluyendo los equipos de marketing, ventas, producto y direcci√≥n.
Investigaci√≥n de Mercados: Ayudar a entender el comportamiento del consumidor online, las tendencias del mercado y el an√°lisis de la competencia en el entorno digital.



Requisitos:


Conocimientos de Marketing Digital: SEO, SEM, redes sociales, e-mail marketing, marketing de contenidos.
Capacidad Anal√≠tica: Habilidad para pensar de forma cr√≠tica, identificar problemas y proponer soluciones basadas en datos.
Estad√≠stica B√°sica: Comprensi√≥n de conceptos estad√≠sticos para validar an√°lisis y pruebas.
Visualizaci√≥n de Datos: Capacidad de crear gr√°ficos y dashboards que cuenten una historia con los datos (ej: Power BI, Tableau, Looker Studio - anteriormente Google Data Studio).
Dominio de Hojas de C√°lculo: Excel/Google Sheets a nivel avanzado.
Habilidades de Comunicaci√≥n: Capacidad para presentar resultados complejos de forma simple e impactante.
Nociones de UX/UI: Entender c√≥mo la experiencia de usuario afecta al rendimiento digital.
SQL (Valorable): Para manipular y extraer datos de bases de datos.
Python/R: Para an√°lisis m√°s avanzados y automatizaci√≥n.
Imprescindible dominio del catal√°n.

Title: Data Analyst - Join our Talent Network!
HTML:
We are looking for Data Analysts in support to our client Fusion for Energy for their location in Barcelona, Spain . The successful applicant will be employed by ATG Europe and will be working onsite at our client‚Äôs location.


Please be aware that this is a proactive job posting. While we are not currently actively hiring for this position, we are always looking for new talent and we welcome expressions of interest for future opportunities.


The successful candidate will be tasked with, but not limited to:

  • Monitoring the status of the incoming and outgoing documentation;
  • Contributing to the organisation, reporting and action tracking of meetings;
  • Contributing to the preparation of internal reporting, monitoring of KPIs, etc.


ATG is dedicated to diversity and inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer. Regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, handicap (+33% certificado de discapacidad) or any other reason protected by relevant state or municipal legislation, we are pleased to consider all eligible candidates for employment.

Please ensure that your CV clearly explains how you meet these mandatory requirements. If it doesn‚Äôt align completely with the essential criteria, it could result in rejection.


Requirements

  • A Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a relevant field, alternatively candidates with vocational training and 5+ years of experience can also be considered;
  • Experience in defining and/or obtaining statistics and/or KPIs related to project documentation and/or technical data;
  • Experience in the development of software applications and/or macros to support the management of data and/or documentation;
  • Experience in data analytics, and in the use of tools such as Power BI and Power Query;
  • Candidates must be eligible to work and live in the EU;
  • Fluency in English both written and spoken.


Please submit your application in English via the apply button below. Applications submitted in other languages will not be considered.

Please complete your application thoroughly, it will allow us to get in contact with you as soon as possible when opportunities arise.

Title: Sales Representative
Description:
Job Purpose and Impact

The Sales Representative I will participate in face-to- face and remote selling to our new and existing customers, selling directly or indirectly through various sales channels. We seek a results-oriented professional who, with guidance, will help assess customer needs and suggest appropriate products, services and solutions.

Key Accountabilities


Contribute to developing and delivering sales bids, presentations and proposals and participating in product demonstrations.
Help identify and contact prospective customers, building relationships to generate future sales and repeat business.
With basic knowledge of products, their characteristics and market, sell and stimulate demand for a series of products.
Plan daily activities, including customer visits and quantitative and qualitative objectives to achieve.
Follow market and competition evolution, passing information to senior staff.
Handle basic issues and problems under direct supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff.
Other duties as assigned


Qualifications


Minimum 2 years of relevant experience.
Strong communication, negotiation, and relationship-building skills.
Self-motivated, responsible, and able to work independently.
Willingness to travel and work in assigned territories.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Animal Science, Veterinary Medicine, or related fields.

Title: The Vietage Butler
Description:
Company Description

Anantara is a luxury hospitality brand for modern travellers, connecting guests to genuine places, people and stories through personal experiences and providing heartfelt hospitality in the world‚Äôs most exciting destinations.

The Vietage by Anantara is a 12-seat reservation-only carriage on the daily return railway route between Da Nang - Quy Nhon - Nha Trang in South Central Vietnam, offering luxury train travel experiences for guests exploring Vietnam. The Vietage departs from Da Nang station every morning for the six-hour journey to Quy Nhon then Nha Trang and returns

Job Description

Vietage Team Members ‚Äì Butlers always find new ways to look after the business, their guests, and their colleagues. Within this, the key responsibilities for this position are:


To work as a team with colleagues in all functions of the train, to ensure timely service and a smooth-running operation.
To understand and adhere to all train policies and Standard Operating Procedures regarding guest service, how to run the operation, and personal discipline and grooming.
To have a full knowledge of the services and facilities provided by Vietage to answer any questions the guests may have.
Follow all safety policies to ensure a safe work area
Follow all reasonable work-related requests made by a Manager or Supervisor which may be outside your normal job activities, to achieve complete guest satisfaction and service throughout the train.
Maintain the carriage in accordance with standards at all times
Develop a complete knowledge of menus
Learn and correctly use the Point-of-Sale equipment and follow procedures
To maintain strict security measures when entering guest cabins, to maintain the privacy rights of our guests.
Actively participate in all training meetings, to continually develop professional skills and increase guest satisfaction.
Clean and break down trays in dish area, watching for condiments, salt, pepper, sugars, salt & pepper, etc.
Performs other job-related duties as Manager / Supervisor assigned


Qualifications


Experience as a Butler or similar role in the hospitality industry
excellent English communication skills.
Strong multi-tasking skills
Excellent organizational skills
Ability to adapt to a fluid environment
Commitment to a high level of customer service
Strict attention to detail
Knowledge of area restaurants, theaters and other attractions
Ability to handle sensitive matters with efficiency and discretion
Knowledge of food and wine pairings is a plus


Additional Information

https://www.thevietagetrain.com
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Story so far: Who we are

Founded in August 2020, Huspy started as a digital mortgage platform and quickly evolved into the largest proptech company in the EMEA region. Backed by leading investors such as Sequoia, Balderton, Founders Fund, and Olayan, we have experienced rapid growth with offices in Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Madrid, and Valencia. Our mission is to revolutionize the real estate industry by building an all-in-one super app designed to empower agents and mortgage brokers.

The Main Event: What You‚Äôll Do

At Huspy, our Data team powers growth and innovation by transforming data into actionable insights. As a Senior Data Analyst, you‚Äôll empower both strategic decision-making and product development by delivering robust dashboards, insightful analyses, and data-driven recommendations.

Key Responsibilities:

Design, build, and maintain dashboards in Tableau (preferred) or similar tools to deliver clear, actionable insights.
Extract, clean, and analyze data using SQL and Python from platforms like Snowflake.
Optimize and scale reporting systems for efficiency and accessibility.
Monitor product KPIs such as user engagement, feature usage, and success metrics.
Conduct experiments to guide product decisions and roadmaps.
Analyze user behavior to assess feature performance and optimize rollouts.
Partner with product, engineering, and business teams to align analytics with strategic goals.
Translate business questions into analytical requirements and provide data-driven insights.

The Perfect Match: What You Bring

Experience: 5‚Äì8 years in data analytics or product analytics.

The Story so far: Who we are

Founded in August 2020, Huspy started as a digital mortgage platform and quickly evolved into the largest proptech company in the EMEA region. Backed by leading investors such as Sequoia, Balderton, Founders Fund, and Olayan, we have experienced rapid growth with offices in Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Madrid, and Valencia. Our mission is to revolutionize the real estate industry by building an all-in-one super app designed to empower agents and mortgage brokers.

The Main Event: What You‚Äôll Do

At Huspy, our Data team powers growth and innovation by transforming data into actionable insights. As a Senior Data Analyst, you‚Äôll empower both strategic decision-making and product development by delivering robust dashboards, insightful analyses, and data-driven recommendations.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and maintain dashboards in Tableau (preferred) or similar tools to deliver clear, actionable insights.
  • Extract, clean, and analyze data using SQL and Python from platforms like Snowflake.
  • Optimize and scale reporting systems for efficiency and accessibility.
  • Monitor product KPIs such as user engagement, feature usage, and success metrics.
  • Conduct experiments to guide product decisions and roadmaps.
  • Analyze user behavior to assess feature performance and optimize rollouts.
  • Partner with product, engineering, and business teams to align analytics with strategic goals.
  • Translate business questions into analytical requirements and provide data-driven insights.

The Perfect Match: What You Bring

  • Experience: 5‚Äì8 years in data analytics or product analytics.

  • Tools & Technical Skills:

    • Advanced SQL and Python (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib)

    • Experience with tools like Tableau, or Looker

    • Familiarity with product analytics tools such as Amplitude (preferred), Mixpanel, or Google Analytics

    • Knowledge of Snowflake, dbt, and Airflow for data warehousing and data pipelines

  • Analytical Strengths:

    • Strong background in hypothesis testing, and regression analysis

    • Proven ability to turn complex data into actionable insights

    • Understanding of ETL and data transformation workflows

  • Soft Skills:

    • Excellent communication skills to explain analytical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences

    • Collaborative mindset and experience working across departments

  • Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field; Master‚Äôs degree is a plus.

  • Languages: English proficiency (spoken and written)

What Will Set You Apart

  • Direct experience with our tech stack: Tableau, Amplitude, Snowflake, dbt, Airflow

  • Experience in fast-paced, data-driven environments such as startups or PropTech

  • Strong business acumen with a deep understanding of product and business KPIs

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About MIGx

MIGx is a global consulting company with an exclusive focus on the healthcare and life science industries, with their particularly demanding requirements on quality and regulatory aspects. We have been managing challenges and solving problems for our clients in the areas of compliance, business processes and many others.




MIGx interdisciplinary teams from Switzerland, Spain and Georgia have been taking care of projects in the fields of M&A, Integration, Application, Data Platforms, Processes, IT management, Digital transformation, Managed services and compliance.




About the profile

We‚Äôre looking for a data-driven professional with a passion for turning both structured and unstructured data into meaningful insights. You enjoy exploring data, organizing it into clear models, and bringing it to life through compelling dashboards that deliver real business value.




Project Description

As part of this project, you will develop interactive and insightful dashboards using Tableau and/or Power BI, drawing from multiple, integrated data sources. You will join a cross-functional team at MIGx focused on delivering high-impact Data Services and scalable Data Products for our clients‚Äîprimarily medium to large enterprises.

This role offers an excellent opportunity to expand your capabilities in the data domain. In addition to working on a key data visualization initiative, you will contribute to implementing modern data architecture principles‚Äîguided by best practices such as Data Mesh, Microsoft Fabric, and the Medallion Architecture‚Äîto ensure scalability, modularity, and alignment with business goals.




Responsibilities

Design and develop dashboards using Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools to support data-driven decision-making.
Build semantic data models to enable efficient reporting and analytics.
Integrate and configure multiple data sources, with a focus on SQL-based systems.
Generate and maintain analytical reports tailored to business requirements.
Perform ad-hoc data analysis to support various business stakeholders.
Collaborate closely with data engineers and analysts to ensure data accuracy, performance, and usability.







Requirements - Must have

Strong proficiency in Data Analytics and Data Visualization principles
3+ years of hands-on experience with at least one modern reporting tool ‚Äì Tableau preferred
Proven skills in designing and developing interactive dashboards and reports
Advanced SQL expertise and solid understanding of relational databases such as MS SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, or PostgreSQL
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure, Google, GCP or AWS
Comfortable working in an agile development environment (e.g., Scrum, Kanban)




Requirements - Nice to have

Experience in building ETL pipelines (Extract, Transform, Load)
Proficiency in Python for data manipulation or automation
Exposure to Microsoft Fabric and Power BI environments




Languages

English ‚Äì B2 / C1







What we offer

Hybrid work model and flexible working schedule that would suit night owls and early birds
Excellent compensation package
25 holiday days per year
Free English classes
Possibilities of career development and the opportunity to shape the company future
An employee-centric culture directly inspired by employee feedback - your voice is heard, and your perspective encouraged
Different training programs to support your personal and professional development
Work in a fast growing, international company
Friendly atmosphere and supportive Management team

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Pozuelo de Alarc√≥n, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Verisure is seeking a talented, innovative, passionate¬†Data Analyst to join our growing and successful Group Marketing Team, reporting to the Group Head of Web development & Analytics.

Verisure is building a talented and passionate Digital Marketing Team, and the Data Analyst position is key to its success! This is your chance to visibly impact on Verisure‚Äôs growth and the development of a best-in-class organization.

The role‚Äôs relevance in data collection and analysis is a great opportunity for a strong talent to develop our organization‚Äôs growth. Our success depends on our people, and we invest in them every day. Working with Verisure is being part of an industry leading, world-class company that thrives on a strong entrepreneurial spirit.

Key Responsibilities

As a core member of the Group Digital Marketing team, the Data Analyst will play a crucial role in driving data-informed decision-making by performing the following responsibilities:

Improving the quality and consistency of digital marketing tracking, collaborating with technical teams to maintain a robust data infrastructure and ensure the integrity of analytics data.
Designing, building, and maintaining marketing performance dashboards and reports using Tableau, Looker Studio or similar data visualization tools, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and usability for diverse stakeholders.
Engaging with cross-functional stakeholders to understand business needs, translate them into data requirements, and deliver actionable insights through compelling analysis and visual storytelling.
Partnering with teams across the organization, including Product, CRM, and Web, to identify data opportunities, support campaign measurement, and foster a data-driven culture.
Extracting and manipulating data using SQL to support advanced analytics and reporting needs.
Contributing to the development and lifecycle of Adtech products, including participation in requirement definition, data architecture design, and ongoing maintenance.

Location

The position will be based in Madrid (Spain).

Candidate profile

Qualifications, Experiences, and Competencies

Required Qualifications

Education & Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Marketing, or a related field.
Minimum of 2‚Äì3 years of experience in data analysis within a digital marketing or Adtech environment.
Experience working in multinational or cross-market teams is a plus.

Technical Skills

Good understanding of digital tracking technologies, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and custom event tracking.
Solid experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker Studio.
Familiarity with digital marketing platforms (e.g. Google Ads, Meta Ads, DV360, etc.).
Knowledge of marketing KPIs, attribution models, customer journey analysis, and performance measurement.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, cleaning, and manipulation across large datasets.
Ability to handle large datasets and navigate data warehouse environments (experience with BigQuery is a plus).
Basic understanding of Python or R for automation and exploratory data analysis is an advantage.

Analytical & Business Acumen

Strong ability to translate business problems into analytical questions and deliver actionable insights.
Working knowledge of conversion funnel analysis, CRO strategies, and campaign optimization.
Experience with A/B testing design, analysis, and interpretation is a plus.

Communication & Collaboration

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, CRM, Design, and Content.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced environment.

Languages

Fluent English is required (written and spoken).
Other languages (e.g. Spanish, French, German, or Nordic languages) are a plus.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience working with Google BigQuery or similar cloud-based data platforms.
Exposure to Adtech environments, CDPs (Customer Data Platforms), or server-side tracking.
Experience with automated reporting solutions or building data pipelines.
Familiarity with marketing mix modeling, predictive analytics, or machine learning use cases.
Certifications such as:
Google Analytics Certification
Tableau/Power BI certifications
Meta or Google Ads certifications

Strong fit with our Company DNA

Passionate in Everything We Do: Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly.¬†

Committed to Making a Difference: When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline.¬†

Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it‚Äôs a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously.¬†

Winning as a Team: Our people know that by leveraging one another‚Äôs strengths, investing in and developing our team‚Äôs capability and by collaborating well, we will win.

With Trust & Responsibility: Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.

The Company

Verisure is the leading European provider of professionally monitored security systems with 24/7 response services. We protect more than 5 million families and small businesses across 17 countries in Europe and Latin America. And our mission is to provide our customers peace of mind by protecting what matters most to them.

With over 35 years of insight, experience, and innovation, Verisure is known for category-creating marketing, sales excellence, innovative products and services, and customer-centricity. Thanks to a strong focus on high quality, our customers are amongst the most satisfied and loyal in our industry. We have some of the strongest double-digit growth and retention rates globally in consumer-facing services which demonstrates our exceptional service levels and strong value proposition to our customers.

Diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging at Verisure

At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative. We reject all forms of discrimination and bias, and we believe in access to opportunities for everyone, regardless of gender, age, disability status, race, sexual orientation, or any other status. Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging values are embedded in our company‚Äôs DNA. And we continue to prioritise our DEIB efforts every day to create a more inclusive organisation, enable diverse representation of our community, and ensure equity and meritocracy every step of the way.
¬†

Title: AI & Data Analytics Intern
Description:
Our Group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Together with our 96.000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are committed to accelerating the transition to a carbon neutral economy through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally friendly solutions.




Are you passionate about data and looking to jumpstart your career in analytics and artificial intelligence?

Join our dynamic Madrid team as an AI & Data Analytics Intern and gain hands-on experience leveraging data to drive meaningful insights and decision-making.




Mission

This role will provide you with a comprehensive understanding of the full data lifecycle, from ETL processes to visualization, while allowing you to actively contribute to critical projects and improve existing systems.







As AI & Data Analytics intern, your main responsibilities will involve:

Documentation: Assist in documenting processes to ensure clarity and consistency across projects.
Database Normalization: Work on optimizing and structuring databases following the ENGIE Spain standards
Process Standardization: Help establish and maintain standardized workflows and procedures.
SQL Query and View Unification: Collaborate on consolidating and improving SQL queries and views for better performance and maintainability.
Full Data Stack Support: Support the entire data lifecycle, from ETL processes to dashboard development in Power BI.
Idea Generation: Actively propose and develop innovative ideas to improve processes and solutions. All suggestions will be welcomed and evaluated!




We imagine that you:

Are Data driven and interested in renewables
Enjoy handling data and tools to extract actionable insights.
Are proficiency in Python, SQL, and Power BI.
Are about to finish a top numerical degree/master (in Computer Science, Information Technology, Physics, Maths, Business Analytics, Engineering Degree, Economics or Statistics)
Are fluent in English ‚Üí C1.




Competencies required for the job position

Excellent critical thinking skills
Strong analytical & problem-solving skills
Strong time-management skills
Detail oriented and highly organized
Communication skills
Teamwork culture
Skilled in negotiation
Customer Success Oriented




Committed to inclusion

At ENGIE we value and encourage diversity and inclusion. We are committed to accelerating the transition to a carbon-neutral economy achieved by integrating exceptional and diverse individuals that seek, support, and strengthen each other‚Äôs growth.




What We Offer

Paid internships lasting 6 months to 1 year.
Full-time schedule: Monday to Thursday (full day) and Friday (reduced hours). // Summer reduced schedule from Monday to Friday during July and August.
Hybrid work model (50% remote) after the first three months.
Professional growth and future career opportunities.
A chance to gain experience in a growing and continuously evolving organization.
A dynamic, professional, and positive work environment.
Integration into a highly qualified team.
State-of-the-art office facilities.
Discounted membership for the on-site gym.
‚ÄúChill Out‚Äù zones.




ENGIE is the answer if...

- You are looking for a solid professional project with professional projection.

- You value being part of the first independent energy group in the world.

- You want to grow and develop within a dynamic and challenging company.

- If you consider that your work, together with the efforts of the people who are part of the company, can and should have a positive impact on the environment.




If you want to be part of an international group, able to offer a wide variety of jobs in a dynamic and promising sector, we are waiting for you!

As AI & Data Analytics intern, your main responsibilities will involve:

  • Documentation: Assist in documenting processes to ensure clarity and consistency across projects.
  • Database Normalization: Work on optimizing and structuring databases following the ENGIE Spain standards
  • Process Standardization: Help establish and maintain standardized workflows and procedures.
  • SQL Query and View Unification: Collaborate on consolidating and improving SQL queries and views for better performance and maintainability.
  • Full Data Stack Support: Support the entire data lifecycle, from ETL processes to dashboard development in Power BI.
  • Idea Generation: Actively propose and develop innovative ideas to improve processes and solutions. All suggestions will be welcomed and evaluated!


We imagine that you:

  • Are Data driven and interested in renewables
  • Enjoy handling data and tools to extract actionable insights.
  • Are proficiency in Python, SQL, and Power BI.
  • Are about to finish a top numerical degree/master (in Computer Science, Information Technology, Physics, Maths, Business Analytics, Engineering Degree, Economics or Statistics)
  • Are fluent in English ‚Üí C1.


Competencies required for the job position

  1. Excellent critical thinking skills
  2. Strong analytical & problem-solving skills
  3. Strong time-management skills
  4. Detail oriented and highly organized
  5. Communication skills
  6. Teamwork culture
  7. Skilled in negotiation
  8. Customer Success Oriented


Committed to inclusion

At ENGIE we value and encourage diversity and inclusion. We are committed to accelerating the transition to a carbon-neutral economy achieved by integrating exceptional and diverse individuals that seek, support, and strengthen each other‚Äôs growth.


What We Offer

  • Paid internships lasting 6 months to 1 year.
  • Full-time schedule: Monday to Thursday (full day) and Friday (reduced hours). // Summer reduced schedule from Monday to Friday during July and August.
  • Hybrid work model (50% remote) after the first three months.
  • Professional growth and future career opportunities.
  • A chance to gain experience in a growing and continuously evolving organization.
  • A dynamic, professional, and positive work environment.
  • Integration into a highly qualified team.
  • State-of-the-art office facilities.
  • Discounted membership for the on-site gym.
  • ‚ÄúChill Out‚Äù zones.


ENGIE is the answer if...

- You are looking for a solid professional project with professional projection.

- You value being part of the first independent energy group in the world.

- You want to grow and develop within a dynamic and challenging company.

- If you consider that your work, together with the efforts of the people who are part of the company, can and should have a positive impact on the environment.


If you want to be part of an international group, able to offer a wide variety of jobs in a dynamic and promising sector, we are waiting for you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Kapsch is one of Austria's most successful global technology companies. With its comprehensive ITS (Intelligent Transportation Systems) portfolio, Kapsch is actively addressing the challenges of the present and the future with intelligent mobility solutions in a wide range of application areas. As a family-owned company founded in 1892 and headquartered in Vienna, Kapsch can look back on 130 years of experience with the future.




We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst and Data Visualization Engineer to support the development of our Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) portfolio. Our products include data and video analytics platforms for traffic management and tolling, an OCR (Optical Character Recognition) engine, and stereo vision cameras for vehicle classification. In this role, you will work with large and complex datasets to extract insights that drive innovation, optimize system performance, and inform product decisions. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams - including software engineering, AI/ML, and product management - and build dashboards to visualize key performance indicators for real-time monitoring and decision support.




Your responsibilities:

Generate actionable insights from large datasets to improve traffic and tolling solutions.
Design and build dashboards (e.g., in Qlik, Power BI) to visualize complex data and support real-time operational decisions.
Work with engineering and product teams to develop user-centric analytics features (e.g., alert systems, operator dashboards).
Analyze traffic sensor data to optimize tolling accuracy and reduce misclassification and revenue loss.
Identify patterns and trends from traffic data to support new use cases, such as congestion prediction or adaptive signaling.
Monitor AI model performance and support ongoing model retraining and customization across varying environments.
Use predictive analytics to anticipate traffic bottlenecks, optimize toll operations, and improve safety.
Support regulatory compliance by automating reporting processes and ensuring data integrity.




Required Skills & Qualifications:

Strong SQL skills and experience with relational and columnar databases.
Solid understanding of dimensional data models (star/snowflake schemas).
Experience with Python and SQL for data manipulation and extraction
Hands-on experience with Linux, Bash, Gitlab/Github, Cloud Computing
Proficiency in QLIK Sense, Power BI or similar dashboard tools.
Experience working with large datasets (‚Äúbig data‚Äù) in operational environments.
Analytical mindset and solution driven personality.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
You practice and live the agile mindset
Good oral and written English
Experience in treating with customers
Presentations skills




Nice to have:

Experience in tolling or traffic management is a plus.
Experience with traffic related models like DATEX2, SIRI, GTFS, MDS, etc.
Experience with traffic simulators like SUMO, Aimsun, PTV Vissim/Vissum




Our offer:

Pernanent role
Flexible working hours
Hybrid working model (2 days at the office/week)
30 business days of annual leave
Flexible remuneration plan
Challenging the limits of mobility for a healthy world without congestion
Adiverse and dynamic international working environment of Kapsch TrafficCom and opportunities for personal growth
Possibility to work in an international company that operates in a dynamic industry where the working environment favors the professional growth
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas ‚Äì immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care ‚Äì and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

Job Description

The Data Analyst will work within Customer Engagement Analytics team in Spain, to provide technical expertise in Advance/Predictive/Prescriptive Analytics. The key responsibilities of the role will be to contribute to AbbVie Data Analytics projects and support Data Science projects. Should be highly analytical with love and high affinity for analysis, mathematics and statistics. Additionally, not only should be familiar with quantitative methodologies and programming but also keen on business acumen. The Data Analyst should have passion for data analysis, data quality and accuracy, data exploration, machine learning and out of the box thinking.

Key responsibilities:

Serve as a relevant member of Customer Engagement Analytics, working in close partnership with the rest of team member and Global Winning with Data team to implement global and local initiatives in the affiliate, becoming a trusted partner of the CEx local team.

Develop in collaboration with the commercial teams and other CEx teams, advanced analytics, identify synergies, optimize reporting strategy to generate business relevant outcomes.

Master in different Foundry datasets of varying complexity and size levels and develop new ways to generate creative predictive analytic solutions to work around data limitations.

Identify best practices and extend them to the rest of the organization in terms of repoting & analytics, Proactively identify new analytical approaches that would improve our ability to answer key business questions, by closely collaborating with key business partners to transform key business questions to insights.

Work with business stakeholders to define key business questions, requirements, timelines, objectives and success factors for winning with data initiatives.

Qualifications

BS degree in mathematics, statistics or engineering, computer science or economics complemented with a master in Big Data, Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Data Science or equivalent.

Portfolio of work demonstrating data science applications.

Minimum of 2 years of applied data science in fields such as data engineering, predictive modelling,

Experience developing and executing data analytica to address key business questions with positive and measurable outcomes.

Experience analyzing and drawing insights from key internally and externally generated data sets.

Essential skills:

Analytical reasoning abilities, intellectual curiosity, strong business acumen and creative problem solving.

Ability to interact effectively with/present to (verbally or written) to all levels of the organization.

Ability to be agile and nimble changing business conditions, strong collaborative relationships, teamwork across different functions and teams to contribute to productive culture.

Lead strategically and create trust within the team.

Additional Information

AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives and serving our community.‚ÄØ Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled.

US & Puerto Rico only - to learn more, visit https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/equal-employment-opportunity-employer.html

US & Puerto Rico applicants seeking a reasonable accommodation, click here to learn more:

https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/reasonable-accommodations.html

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst ‚Äì Barcelona (Hybrid)




We‚Äôre working with a global organisation at the forefront of innovation in human and animal health. They‚Äôre looking for a skilled Data Analyst - Backend to join their growing team in Barcelona. This is a fantastic opportunity to work in a purpose-driven environment where data plays a central role in shaping decisions that impact lives.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and implement scalable data models, with a focus on star schemas.
Build and maintain data transformation pipelines using DBT.
Work with Snowflake to manage and analyse large datasets.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business needs into actionable data insights.




What We‚Äôre Looking For:

Solid experience in a data analyst or similar role.
Strong understanding of data modelling principles.
Proficiency with DBT and Snowflake.
A collaborative mindset and strong communication skills.
Ideally based in or near Barcelona.




Why Apply?




This is a chance to join a company that:

Is privately owned and committed to long-term innovation.
Invests heavily in research and development.
Offers a supportive, international work culture with real opportunities for growth and development.




If you're looking to take the next step in your data career with a company that values both people and progress, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.




Apply now or get in touch to learn more.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Business Data Analyst to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We Are

At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we‚Äôve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising ‚Ç¨250M to revolutionise digital advertising.




Your Challenge




You will get full ownership of our business data and will be expected to propose and conduct analyses that transform Seedtag‚Äôs data into significant business opportunities and KPI improvements.
You will analyse the performance of our current Contextual products and processes and proactively propose initiatives that seek to improve Seedtag‚Äôs commercial and operational results.
You will develop tools that automate internal processes, increasing the efficiency and efficacy of Seedtag teams.
You will help build tools that enable the democratisation of data inside the company and allow Seedtag teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.
Finally, you will build a solid knowledge of the adTech ecosystem and develop strong business acumen.




What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed




You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Engineering. Specific certifications/education in Data/ Business Intelligence are a plus.
You have 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment, either start-up, corporate or consulting.
You have advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
You have experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools.
You have knowledge of database management systems (e.g., BigQuery, MySQL).
You have experience working with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
You have experience in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar, and you have knowledge of Excel/ Sheets.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business value.
You have the ability to collaborate with business stakeholders to identify information needs and define business requirements.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

It would be a big plus if you

Have experience in forecasting, trend analysis, and predictive modelling.
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders.
Have experience working with Tableau.




Why Join Seedtag?




Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks




Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure?




Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!

At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!


Additional Perks


  • Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
  • Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
  • Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
  • Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.


Ready to join the Seedtag adventure?


Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!

At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¬°Hi! ¬°We are Cheil Spain! üöÄ




Cheil Worldwide is a full-service agency from brand building to digital transformations creating excellent data-driven experiences for every customer. As part of Cheil Worldwide, Cheil Spain plays its part in one of the world‚Äôs biggest agency networks ‚Äì comprising 53 offices and 8 affiliates in 43 countries globally with more than 6.000 employees and 600 clients around the world. Cheil Spain is made up of 100 employees from different disciplines, who are passionate about innovation in all its forms. We offer a wide variety of marketing and advertising services, including strategy and planning, creative, content production, traditional and digital media advertising, influencer marketing, event marketing, e-commerce and performance marketing, among others.




‚úîÔ∏è Your role at Cheil: Data Analyst




‚úîÔ∏è What we are looking for?




We are looking for a highly analytical and business-driven Senior Data Analyst to join our Performance team at Cheil Spain. This role will play a critical part in unlocking insights from web and CRM data to improve user experiences, increase conversions, and inform strategic decisions for Samsung Spain and Portugal.

The ideal candidate has strong expertise in Adobe Analytics and GA4, and a solid understanding of user behavior analysis, segmentation, and digital marketing KPIs. Bonus if you're familiar with SQL, Python, BigQuery, and Qlik.




‚úîÔ∏è Key Responsibilities:




Support CRM and performance initiatives through audience segmentation, behavior analysis, and campaign performance reporting.
Evaluate Campaigns, promotions, marketing channels attribution, the funnel, and much more for the understanding of the customer journey, identifying insights with clear business recommendations
Analyze user journeys and web behavior through Adobe Analytics and GA4 to identify performance trends, drop-offs, and optimization opportunities.
Create dashboards and reports using tools such as Adobe Workspace, Looker Studio, or Power BI to track performance and support internal and client decision-making.
Collaborate closely with UX, CRO, Paid Media, and CRM teams to align data strategies and contribute with actionable insights.
Define KPIs and measurement frameworks for digital marketing initiatives and validate technical tracking implementations (with support from GTM specialists if needed).
Deliver recurring and ad hoc reports for always-on and campaign-based activities, including funnel analysis, campaign attribution, and ecommerce performance.
Present insights clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, connecting data findings with business objectives.
Continuously monitor data quality, track implementation, and propose process improvements to strengthen data-driven decision-making.




‚úîÔ∏è Key Skills & requirements:




4+ years in a Digital Data Analyst role, ideally within an agency or ecommerce environment.
Advanced expertise in Adobe Analytics and Google Analytics 4.
Proven ability to extract, visualize, and present insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience building dashboards and reports using Looker Studio or Power BI.
Strong understanding of digital marketing campaigns, ecommerce KPIs, and data quality validation.
Excellent storytelling and presentation skills in PowerPoint.
Strong communication and teamwork skills, with a strategic business mindset.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with SQL, BigQuery, and Python for data querying and automation tasks.
Understanding of website tagging and event tracking via Google Tag Manager.
Knowledge of Adobe Audience Manager or other CDP tools.
Previous exposure to e-commerce platforms and CRO/UX concepts.
Familiarity with A/B testing frameworks and marketing attribution models.
Fluent in Spanish and English.




Languages:

C1 level of English required, with advanced English writing skills and the ability to communicate effectively with international teams and external suppliers.




‚úîÔ∏è We would like you to bring together attitudes that have to do with...




Working effectively with individuals of diverse cultures, interpersonal styles, abilities, motivations, or backgrounds.
Making the most effective use of the capabilities, insights, and ideas of all individuals.
Inspiring others by generating innovative solutions in work situations .
Trying different and novel ways to deal with work problems and opportunities.
Working effectively and cooperatively with others.
Establishing and maintaining good working relationships.
Setting high goals for personal and group accomplishment.
Tenaciously working to meet or exceed goals by proactively confronting difficult issues.
Establishing and sustaining trusting relationships by accurately perceiving and interpreting one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô emotions and behavior.
Leveraging insights to effectively manage one‚Äôs own responses and reactions.




‚úîÔ∏è Cheil offers you:




üå±Work in a growing environment, focused on creating and innovating with multidisciplinary and multicultural teams in Creativity, Digital Performance, Retail, Data and Technology.

‚úçÔ∏èStable position: Permanent contract because we want you to be part of Cheil and be able to develop with us.

üí∏Salary: To be negotiated based on experience. Bonus Performance.

üìñInternal training opportunities.

‚ù§Ô∏èSocial Benefits: Restaurant Tickets and Medical Insurance.

üïõTimetable from Monday to Thursday from 09.00-18.15 and Fridays from 09.00-15.00. July and August, we have an intensive working day, Monday to Friday from 8:00 - 15:00.

üíªHybrid working model.

üèñÔ∏è22 days of annual leave, plus 24 and 31 December and Advertising Day.

üí∞Possibility of incentive for attracting new clients and new employees to Cheil. Help us to keep growing!

üìçWe are located in Alcobendas and we have a direct bus service, 100% free, with departures from Plaza Castilla, Chamart√≠n and Nuevos Ministerios to our offices.




‚úîÔ∏è Next steps:




Are you motivated by what you have just read? Join Cheil!

If you are passionate about the world of advertising and have experience leading teams, we invite you to send your CV and cover letter. We hope to have a high-level professional who will help us continue to grow in the market.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst JR
Description:
BI ANALYST JR




Your New Role

Join our team as a strategic link between Finance and Business Intelligence. You'll put your storytelling skills into practice and take your creativity and logic to the next level by solving business challenges and delivering high-impact solutions that optimize established processes. You‚Äôll collaborate with different areas of the business and report directly to the Head of Business Intelligence.




Requirements

Minimum 1 year of experience in data processing.
Minimum 1 year of experience programming in Python.
Minimum 6 months of experience with MySQL/PostgreSQL queries.
Degree in Physics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Data Science, or Finance.




Technical Requirements

Python (basic): pandas (dataframes, groupby, pivot_table), numpy (math functions and vectorization).
MySQL: proficient with joins, group by, subqueries.
Excel (intermediate): pivot tables, advanced formulas, data import/export.
Experience with ETL from multiple sources.
Knowledge of the financial services or asset-backed lending sector.




Nice to Have

Data visualization: interactive dashboards with Plotly Express or Tableau.
SQLAlchemy: pipeline orchestration and Python‚Äìdatabase integration.




Soft Skills

Attention to detail and data quality.
Autonomy and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Clear communication and collaborative work within global teams.
Proactivity and a focus on continuous optimization.

  • Python (basic): pandas (dataframes, groupby, pivot_table), numpy (math functions and vectorization).
  • MySQL: proficient with joins, group by, subqueries.
  • Excel (intermediate): pivot tables, advanced formulas, data import/export.
  • Experience with ETL from multiple sources.
  • Knowledge of the financial services or asset-backed lending sector.


Nice to Have

  • Data visualization: interactive dashboards with Plotly Express or Tableau.
  • SQLAlchemy: pipeline orchestration and Python‚Äìdatabase integration.


Soft Skills

  • Attention to detail and data quality.
  • Autonomy and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Clear communication and collaborative work within global teams.
  • Proactivity and a focus on continuous optimization.

Title: Junior Data Analyst (They/She/He) - HQ
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: Building the largest marketplace in your city, to give access to anything in minutes. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

We are seeking a highly motivated and analytical Junior Rider Experience Analyst to join our Rider Experience team. In this role, you will play a key role in shaping the loyalty strategy for our riders. You‚Äôll be responsible for analyzing the performance of our loyalty program, designing data-driven strategies to increase engagement and retention, and optimizing initiatives that drive riders satisfaction and frequency.

THE JOURNEY


Data Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret rider experience data, including feedback, performance metrics, and operational data, to identify trends, issues, and opportunities for improvement.
Insights & Reporting: Develop comprehensive reports and dashboards that communicate key rider experience metrics and insights to stakeholders.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with operations and product teams to implement initiatives that enhance the rider experience.
Program Optimization: Define and continuously refine tier thresholds based on behavioral data, operational impact, and business goals.
Strategy & Engagement: Design and monitor quests, missions, and challenges aimed at increasing frequency, loyalty, and overall engagement.
Benchmarking: Research industry best practices and competitor strategies related to rider experience to identify new opportunities.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Bachelor's degree in Business, Data Analytics, Economics, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a similar analytical role, preferably within the logistics, e-commerce, or gig economy sectors.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python/R for data analysis).
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker Studio).
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights clearly and concisely to diverse audiences.
Proactive, self-starter with a strong sense of ownership and accountability.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.


Nice To Have


Experience with rider-facing platforms or applications.
Knowledge of qualitative research methods.
Experience in A/B testing and experimentation.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A Little Bit About Us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How you will make a difference:


Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards



Requirements


Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams
Proactive attitude and results-oriented



Benefits

Perks of being one of us


Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
We celebrate all company landmarks


Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressi√≥n and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: Data Analyst para Proyecci√≥n de Margen Financiero
Description:
Somos Banco Sabadell




Banco Sabadell es una de las principales entidades bancarias en Espa√±a con m√°s de 14.000 personas caracterizadas por nuestra implicaci√≥n, esp√≠ritu de colaboraci√≥n y dinamismo. Banco Sabadell ofrece sus servicios a m√°s de 11 millones de clientes contando con una posici√≥n privilegiada en el segmento de empresas.




Nuestra raz√≥n de ser es ayudar a personas y empresas a hacer realidad sus proyectos, anticip√°ndonos y ocup√°ndonos de que tomen las mejores decisiones econ√≥micas, a trav√©s de nuestros valores: el compromiso, no conformismo, profesionalidad, eficacia, empat√≠a y franqueza.

Y adem√°s, lo hacemos mediante una gesti√≥n responsable y comprometida con el medio ambiente.




¬°√önete a nosotros!




¬øQu√© estamos buscando?




Actualmente buscamos un perfil con capacidad anal√≠tica, alto grado de atenci√≥n al detalle y rigurosidad, que aporte iniciativa y proactividad para alcanzar los objetivos comunes y capacidad para resolver problemas, siendo auto exigente y organizado, para integrarse en el equipo de Proyecci√≥n de Escenarios en la Unidad de An√°lisis de Margen Financiero del Grupo.




Hablemos del proyecto‚Ä¶




Tu misi√≥n principal se centrar√° en participar en la elaboraci√≥n del ejercicio de Stress Test relativo al margen de intereses del Grupo Banco Sabadell, colaborando en el dise√±o y mejora de los procesos de extracci√≥n y aprovisionamiento de datos, en el an√°lisis de la razonabilidad de los resultados obtenidos, as√≠ como en su interpretaci√≥n.




Entre tus responsabilidades principales se encontrar√°n:

Dise√±ar√°s, desarrollar√°s y revisar√°s procedimientos utilizando SQL, Visual Basic y SAS para optimizar procesos y garantizar la calidad de los datos.
