Title: Data Consultant
Description:
ABOUT US

Syniti is the enterprise data partner, empowering anyone who relies on data to make business-critical decisions by delivering data they can trust through a unique combination of intelligent software and experts who deeply understand the role of data in enterprise growth.

Trusted by the Fortune 2000, Syniti helps leading businesses reconfigure the role of enterprise data from afterthought to foundational first step, enabling them to unlock valuable insights that ignite growth, reduce risk, and expand their competitive advantage.




Syniti‚Äôs Data First philosophy and enterprise data management platform supports data migration, data quality, data replication, data matching, master data management, analytics, data governance, and data strategy in a single, unified solution.

As an innovative, global leader in Enterprise Data Management, the combination of our award-winning software platform and premier consultants creates a unique advantage for leading enterprises. Syniti is also a preferred data solution used by the world‚Äôs top system integrators. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, with offices in 25 countries around the world, Syniti operates in all global regions and industry verticals and maintains a 100% client success rate across thousands of complex data projects and initiatives.




THE ROLE

We are recruiting talented and motivated individuals to join our team delivering data projects for clients across the globe. As a Data Consultant at Syniti, you will work closely with functional consultants and key customer resources, gathering requirements, building conversion objects, and driving independent value through all data project phases. You will comfortably use your data skills and the Syniti data management platform to assess and iterate through design, build, and deployment, ensuring that the highest customer value is derived from your assigned objects. As a member of a Syniti Data Migration team, you will execute against the best practices for successful business transformation and become skilled in the strongest platform to meet all of our customers‚Äô needs.




WHAT YOU WILL DO

After an initial training period, a Senior Consultant will be expected to:

Demonstrate a strong understanding of Syniti‚Äôs Data Migration methodology.
Demonstrate strong proficiency in Syniti‚Äôs tools, working to prescribed development standards.
Good understanding of business processes for one or more assigned functional areas, and the ability to quickly learn about new areas.
Demonstrate strong knowledge of underlying technical data structures and definitions of assigned functional process areas.
Develop data migration rules and reports in Syniti‚Äôs tools as per the supplied specification
Evaluate and contribute to ongoing data migration design for assigned process areas through data analysis, reporting, and collaboration with on-site Syniti and client colleagues
Create and maintain data load programs
Maintain related documentation and communicate status to Syniti Team Leadership and customer PMO.
Execution of end-to-end data loads and reconciliations




WHAT IT TAKES

Degree-level qualification in Computer Science (or other technology-related field)
Experience in ETL / Data Migration / Data Quality / Data Analysis
Experience with ABAP
Functional ERP experience
Project experience across multiple ERP implementations
Database experience - SQL Server, Oracle, etc.
Customer-facing skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Willingness to travel according to project requirements up to 100%




WHAT WE OFFER

Trust that you are proficient at what you do. At Syniti, you will find a supportive environment and access to learning tools, but micromanagement is not our thing.
Growth. We are growing rapidly and steadily, solving the biggest challenges enterprise companies face today. There has never been a better time to join and grow with us. Most importantly, you will have the chance to shape our journey and share in our success story.
Support. We all rely on each other and enable each other to be successful. You won‚Äôt stand alone.
Curiosity and genuine interest in you. We all have our different stories, all equally fascinating, with each depicting a different journey, and we want to hear them all.
Recognition. We are the sum of individual achievements, and we always take the time to celebrate them.
An open organisation. Hierarchies are not our thing, and access is something we make sure of across the board. We are a family where everyone is just as important, everyone‚Äôs work is seen, and ideas are valued.

Title: IT Data Analyst
Description:
Techsoulogy is our way of doing things and our corporate brand that unifies a broad portfolio of specialist advertising, media, and entertainment firms. It combines the latest technology with a human-first approach and a constant exploration of knowledge in order to shape the media landscape.

At Techsoulogy we aim to provide a technology and human service that guarantee all areas of the advertising industry throughout the world achieving their goals profitably, effectively and ethically.

Our values drive our culture, which is the most important asset of our company.


We're fair
We're dedicated
We're honest
We're courageous
We're Team lovers


TAPPX with Techsoulogy

Tappx is a fast-growth AdTech company inside the Techsoulogy family. It delivers digital advertising solutions for multiple platforms including mobile, OTT/CTV and desktop.

Tappx‚Äô proprietary technology empowers publishers to maximize ad revenues across mobile and OTT channels. It offers a distinct point of difference, technology which has been specifically engineered for mobile and OTT markets, thereby offering brands and agencies increased trust and transparency.

Tappx has headlined across numerous high profile competitive growth rankings such as Red Herring in 2016, TECH5 in 2018 and in 2020 Tappx was featured as Europe‚Äôs 2nd fastest growing advertising company in The Financial Times FT1000.

In Tappx we keep growing and, therefore, we are looking for new talented people to join our Data team in our IT department.

As a Data Analyst you will:


Analyze complex datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports in Power BI, Data Studio, and Looker Studio.
Create clear and compelling data visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Ensure visualizations are tailored to meet the specific needs of different audiences.
Extract, clean, and preprocess data from various sources to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Work closely with business units to understand their data needs and provide relevant insights.
Translate business requirements into technical specifications for data projects.
Track and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of initiatives.
Ensure reports are accurate, consistent, and delivered on time.
Stay updated with the latest tools and technologies in data analysis and visualization.
Perform statistical analyses to validate hypotheses and support business case development.
Use statistical methods to quantify the impact of various strategies and initiatives.


Your Dream Job Awaits at Techsoulogy! üöÄ

Indefinite Contract with Competitive Conditions

Flexible Working Hours (Take Control of Your Schedule) with core time

Hybrid Model in Barcelona (1 day in the office and the rest teleworking) or 100% Remote Work Anywhere in Spain

Cool HQ Offices in Barcelona and Co-Working in Madrid

Elevate Your Work Experience with Techsoulogy! üåü

Private Health Insurance

Mental Health Care with 20 Free Hours of Psychologist Support

1&1 English or Spanish Language Lessons

Continuous Training & Development Budget

Healthy Snacks, Coffee and (a lot of) Tea (HQ)

Fun-Filled Arcade Room (HQ)

Team Building Activities

Inspiring Internal Talks and Events

Interesting Employee Referral Program

Engage in Techsoulogy‚Äôs CSR Initiatives

Flexible Compensation for Transport, Meals, and Kindergartens

Ready to shape your future? Join us! üöÄ

#Techsoulogy #CareerPerks #JoinUsNow #WorkPerks #CareerGrowth

Requirements:

We are looking for if you have:


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering and Science programs, Economics, or a related field
3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst in programming languages such as Python, PySpark and experience with data manipulation tools like SQL.
3+ years of experience in data analysis and reporting.
Experience integrating data from a variety of sources.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Experience in HTML and CSS is a plus.


Desirable:


Good at understanding data and extracting insights from it.
Pattern detection.
Fast learner, absorbs new domains quickly.
Proactivity.
Analytical mind.
Problem-solving aptitude.
Knowledge of Python, SQL and GCP.
Curiosity driven.
High level of Spanish
Result oriented

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Powerdot started with the vision that charging your car should be as easy as charging your smartphone. And so for that to happen, chargers need to be available where people naturally spend their days.

Our mission? is as simple as ambitious - Accelerate Sustainable Mobility by investing in, installing, and operating EV chargers with a cutting-edge business model. We help businesses find the right charging solutions for their customers. Today, we‚Äôve partnered with over 1,200 businesses across Portugal, Spain, France, Belgium, Luxembourg, and Poland, with more than 2,200 contracted locations.

Who are we? ü§ù Firstly, we are Partner Obsessed creating bespoke solutions to better serve our partners‚Äô customers. üí° Secondly, we love the challenge of making EV charging simpler, readily available, and integrated with diverse retail and service experiences. üìà Finally, we are all about growing, expanding our network, our partners‚Äô businesses, and the professional development of our team, all while driving the EV ecosystem forward.

Who are you? We seek empowered top performers who share our mission and values, and who are ready to think disruptively and join our exciting journey. üöÄ

The Data Analyst role will be part of the Central Data team at Powerdot and will play a key role in the current phase of accelerated growth of the company. Moreover, the Data Analyst will be responsible for developing insights, analysis and eye-candy visualizations that support business decision making. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences.

Responsibilities


Gather and transform data from a variety of sources, including internal databases, external APIs, and surveys.
Analyze data using statistical techniques to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Develop data visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise way.
Work with stakeholders to understand their needs and develop data-driven solutions.
Maintain and support a culture of strong data quality
Stay up-to-date on the latest data analytics trends.
Mentor co-workers on analytics best practices.


The Candidate We Are Looking For


Up to 4 years of experience in data analytics
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Familiarity with SQL, Python and a data visualization tool such as Tableau, Metabase or Power B
Eagerness to learn and develop in a fast moving environment
Great communication skills
Easiness navigating in ambiguity and complexity
Ability to work independently and as part of a team


Get to know our benefits!


üè• Private health insurance coverage
üí™ Gym membership to help you stay active
‚è∞ Flexible working hours ‚Äî you own your time
üåç 4-day annual offsite where we celebrate the year‚Äôs achievements and spend quality time together (last year we went to Algarve, Portugal!)
ü§ù Regular team-building events with your local teammates
üç© Free office snacks and unlimited coffee
‚ö° Special discounts for charging your electric vehicle


Last but not least, at Powerdot we strongly believe that the best solutions and the most innovative ideas come from the coexistence of people with different backgrounds that reflect the diverse world we live in. We seek for a culture of diversity and inclusion - a culture where equal opportunities and mutual respect prevail and where everyone has the opportunity to speak up, challenge the status quo and make the difference.

The Data Analyst role will be part of the Central Data team at Powerdot and will play a key role in the current phase of accelerated growth of the company. Moreover, the Data Analyst will be responsible for developing insights, analysis and eye-candy visualizations that support business decision making. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences.

Responsibilities

  • Gather and transform data from a variety of sources, including internal databases, external APIs, and surveys.
  • Analyze data using statistical techniques to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
  • Develop data visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise way.
  • Work with stakeholders to understand their needs and develop data-driven solutions.
  • Maintain and support a culture of strong data quality
  • Stay up-to-date on the latest data analytics trends.
  • Mentor co-workers on analytics best practices.

The Candidate We Are Looking For

  • Up to 4 years of experience in data analytics
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Familiarity with SQL, Python and a data visualization tool such as Tableau, Metabase or Power B
  • Eagerness to learn and develop in a fast moving environment
  • Great communication skills
  • Easiness navigating in ambiguity and complexity
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team

Get to know our benefits!

  • üè• Private health insurance coverage
  • üí™ Gym membership to help you stay active
  • ‚è∞ Flexible working hours ‚Äî you own your time
  • üåç 4-day annual offsite where we celebrate the year‚Äôs achievements and spend quality time together (last year we went to Algarve, Portugal!)
  • ü§ù Regular team-building events with your local teammates
  • üç© Free office snacks and unlimited coffee
  • ‚ö° Special discounts for charging your electric vehicle

Last but not least, at Powerdot we strongly believe that the best solutions and the most innovative ideas come from the coexistence of people with different backgrounds that reflect the diverse world we live in. We seek for a culture of diversity and inclusion - a culture where equal opportunities and mutual respect prevail and where everyone has the opportunity to speak up, challenge the status quo and make the difference.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.

Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences. Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work.

Who We're Looking For

We are seeking a talented and detail-oriented Data Analyst with up to 3 years of experience to join our growing team. This role is ideal for someone passionate about turning complex data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making. You will thrive in collaborative environments, demonstrate analytical thinking, and communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. A strong interest in the energy sector and digital behavior analytics will be key to success in this role.

What You'll Do


Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to support business decisions.
Develop and maintain dashboards and interactive reports using Power BI and Looker Studio.
Monitor and interpret digital behavior using Google Analytics 4 (GA4).
Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to support business strategies with data-driven insights.


Who You Are


A data-driven professional with a knack for transforming data into meaningful insights.
A collaborative team player with a keen analytical mindset.
Eager to grow and contribute to impactful projects in the energy industry.
Comfortable communicating complex ideas clearly to varied audiences.


What You'll Need


Up to 3 years of experience in data analytics.
Proficiency with GA4, Power BI, and Looker Studio (required).
Previous experience in the energy sector (required).
Familiarity with Google Tag Manager is a plus.
Fluency in English (written and spoken).
Spanish language skills are a strong plus.


Bonus Points If You Have


Experience working in international or multicultural environments.
A commitment to continuous learning and skill development.
An ability to connect data insights to broader business opportunities.


We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we‚Äôve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office an average of four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.

WPP (VML) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

VML is a WPP Agency. For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML on our social channels via Instagram,‚ÄØLinkedIn, and‚ÄØX.

When you click "Submit Application", this will send any information you add below to VML. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Air Apps

At Air Apps, we believe in thinking bigger‚Äîand moving faster. We‚Äôre a family-founded company on a mission to create the world‚Äôs first AI-powered Personal & Entrepreneurial Resource Planner (PRP), and we need your passion and ambition to help us change how people plan, work, and live. Born in Lisbon, Portugal in 2018‚Äîand now with offices in both Lisbon and San Francisco‚Äîwe‚Äôve remained self-funded while reaching over 100 million downloads worldwide.

Our long-term focus drives us to challenge the status quo every day, pushing the boundaries of AI-driven solutions that truly make a difference. Here, you‚Äôll be a creative force, shaping products that empower people across the globe.

Join us on this journey to redefine resource management‚Äîand change lives along the way.

The Role

As a Data Analyst at Air Apps, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to drive business insights and optimize product performance. You will create reports, dashboards, and performance metrics to help teams make informed decisions and improve user experience.

This role requires a data-driven mindset, strong analytical skills, and experience with visualization tools to turn complex data into actionable insights.

Responsibilities


Analyze user behavior, product performance, and key business metrics to identify trends and opportunities.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or Google Data Studio.
Collect, clean, and structure large datasets to ensure accuracy and usability.
Define and track KPIs for marketing, product, and business performance.
Work with SQL, Python, or R to extract, analyze, and manipulate data.
Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and marketing teams to provide data-driven insights.
Conduct A/B testing and experiment analysis to improve product features and user engagement.
Identify bottlenecks and opportunities in user journeys and customer funnels.
Present findings in a clear and compelling way to stakeholders and leadership teams.
Stay up to date with industry trends, analytics best practices, and emerging data tools.


Requirements


Around 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Strong analytical skills with experience in Python or R for data analysis.
Knowledge of A/B testing methodologies and statistical analysis.
Experience with Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude, or similar user analytics tools.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to communicate insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based data warehouses (BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake).
Familiarity with ETL processes and data pipeline optimization is a plus.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment and manage multiple projects.


What benefits are we offering?


Apple hardware ecosystem for work.
Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) to support work-life balance.
Annual Bonus.
Top-tier Health Insurance for peace of mind.
Public Transportation Pass to support your commute needs.
Coverflex benefits package for meal allowances, well-being, and more.
Air Conference - an opportunity to meet the team, collaborate, and grow together.


Diversity & Inclusion

At Air Apps, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We enthusiastically welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and believe that varied voices and experiences make us stronger.

Application Disclaimer

At Air Apps, we value transparency and integrity in our hiring process. Applicants must submit their own work without any AI-generated assistance. Any use of AI in application materials, assessments, or interviews will result in disqualification.

Title: Analista de Dados
Description:
Na IRIUM queremos que persigas sempre os teus sonhos! Aqui, prepara-te para conquistares as tuas metas, enquanto desfrutas do caminho.

Title: Junior Power BI Consultant
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good.

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

We are looking for a Consultant for the Power BI solution, who will also act as the guarantor of Modern BI and Data Visualization best practices. This role is key to ensuring the technical excellence and strategic evolution of our BI ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities


Act as the go-to expert for Power BI, ensuring adherence to best practices in data visualization and modern BI.
Administer Power BI Services, including workspace organization, access rights, role and authorization management, and data encryption.
Optimize performance through data compression, partitioning, and aggregation strategies.
Design and maintain advanced data models and ensure alignment with broader data architecture.
Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders to understand needs and translate them into effective BI solutions.
Drive continuous improvement through bug fixes, enhancements, and technical quality assurance.


Qualifications


Experience with Power BI implementation.
Strong proficiency in DAX, SQL, and M (Power Query).
Deep understanding of data modeling and data architecture.
Experience with performance optimization techniques in Power BI.
Expertise in data visualization principles and storytelling with data.


Soft Skills


Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Comfortable interacting with both business and technical stakeholders.
Curious, proactive, and eager to stay up to date with BI trends and technologies.


Nice to Have


PL-300: Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst certification.
Experience with Google BigQuery.
Knowledge of Python and ETL tools.
Familiarity with Oracle Database and MongoDB.


Passionate about data, stunning visualizations, and cutting-edge tech? Join us and lead the way in transforming BI with Power BI!"
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we‚Äôre able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Essential Skills


Skilled in data visualization tools such as Power BI and Looker Studio to create clear, actionable reports and dashboards
Experience in Text Mining techniques to extract insights from unstructured data
Expertise in the full ETL process, ensuring data is clean, structured, and ready for analysis and decision-making
Strong working knowledge of GA4, providing in-depth insights into user behavior and marketing performance


What Do I Need Before I Apply

The opportunity is remote but the candidate must already be living in PT.

Title: Product Data Analyst Trainee | Digital Channels
Description:
Country: Portugal

Location: Lisbon (Hybrid)

About Santander

Santander Bank is a leading global financial institution, dedicated to helping individuals

and businesses prosper. With a presence in over 10 countries, we provide a full range of

banking services, including personal, business, and corporate banking. At Santander,

we‚Äôre committed to innovation and continuously improving our digital offerings to meet

the evolving needs of our customers. Our fintech-driven approach emphasizes

leveraging cutting-edge technology to deliver seamless, secure, and personalized

financial experiences.

About The Role

We are looking for a data-driven Product Data Analyst Trainee to join our Digital

Channels team. This role focuses on leveraging data to inform and optimize product

decisions, ensuring our web and app platforms deliver outstanding customer

experiences. The ideal candidate will have basic knowledge of Google Analytics 4 (GA4)

and an analytical background, helping the team with product discovery, business case

development, A/B testing, and the continuous monitoring of key features through

dashboards and reporting tools.

Main Responsibilities


User interaction Analysis: Support in analyzing web and app usage data to uncover


trends, user behavior, and opportunities for product improvement.


Product Discovery Support: Collaborate with Product Managers during the


discovery phase by providing insights from data to identify customer needs and validate

opportunities.


Business Case Development: Contribute to the development of business cases by


providing data-driven insights and projections to evaluate potential product initiatives.


Success Metrics Definition: Partner with stakeholders to define and track key


success metrics for new features and initiatives. Map and define tracking events for key

product metrics (GA4 tagging).


A/B Testing: Design, execute, and analyze A/B tests to validate hypotheses, measure


impact, and optimize product performance.


Dashboard Creation: Help to develop and maintain dashboards for continuous


monitoring of key features, ensuring stakeholders have real-time insights into

performance.


Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Product Managers, Engineers,


Designers, and Marketing teams to ensure data-driven decision-making throughout the

product lifecycle.


GA4 Optimization: Help to ensure best practices are followed on GA4 to maintain


consistency between different conversion funnels

Profile Needed


Experience: Demonstrate interest in data analytics and digital products.
Analytics Expertise: Basic understanding of Google Analytics (GA4 key features), and


of other analytics tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker Studio, Power BI).


Data Storytelling: Ability to transform complex data into clear, actionable insights


and present findings effectively to stakeholders.


Problem-Solving: Strong analytical mindset with a focus on solving complex


problems using data.


A/B Testing: Experience designing and interpreting A/B tests to evaluate product


hypotheses and feature performance.


Collaboration Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with


experience working in cross-functional teams.


Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering,


Mathematics), Economics, Marketing, Business or a related discipline.


Technical Skills: Familiarity with SQL, Python or R for data analysis is a plus. A basic


knowledge or interest of how websites and apps are built (e.g. HTML, CSS, JS) is also valued.

If you‚Äôre passionate about data, user behavior, digital products, and making a

meaningful impact in fintech, this is your opportunity to shine. Join Santander‚Äôs Digital

Channels team as a Product Data Analyst and help us shape the future of banking with data-driven insights!
Show more

Channels team as a Product Data Analyst and help us shape the future of banking with data-driven insights!

Title: Business Data Analyst ‚Äì Commercial
Description:
Location

Hybrid in Lisbon (minimum of 2 days a week from the office)

SHAPE THE FUTURE OF PRIVACY WITH USERCENTRICS

Usercentrics is a global leader in data privacy and privacy-led marketing solutions. We believe there is no need for a trade-off between growth and privacy compliance. Our vision is to unlock the potential of data privacy to empower a thriving digital ecosystem. We work with companies to create a healthy balance between data-driven business and privacy-led marketing for every size of enterprise. Our customers build trust with their users through improved transparency and control to drastically improve marketing and monetization, while achieving full privacy compliance.

We are seeking a highly skilled Business Data Analyst to join our BI Team, with a dedicated focus on supporting the Commercial Team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis, funnel analysis, and commercial performance metrics to deliver actionable insights that drive revenue growth and sales efficiency. You will act as a bridge between data analysis and commercial strategy, enabling data-driven decisions and optimizing commercial operations.

Your Tasks


Act as a dedicated BI partner to the Commercial Team, providing insights to improve sales performance, pipeline management, and revenue generation.
Conduct funnel analysis to understand and optimize the sales process, identifying bottlenecks and areas for improvement.
Analyze sales data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement in sales operations and strategies.
Monitor and report on key sales performance metrics, including pipeline health, win rates, deal velocity, average deal size, etc
Design, develop, and maintain dashboards in Power BI, providing stakeholders with visibility into sales performance and funnel progression.
Use SQL to query and manipulate data from various sources, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Collaborate with commercial leaders to identify opportunities for improvement and provide actionable recommendations based on data insights.
Support forecasting efforts by analyzing historical data and trends, enabling accurate revenue projections.
Stay updated on sales trends, tools, and best practices to continuously enhance reporting and analysis.


You Bring


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Data Analytics, Marketing, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, with a focus on B2B SaaS GTM performance and funnel analysis.
Intermediate skills in SQL for querying and analyzing data.
Expertise in Power BI (or similar tools) for creating dashboards, visualizations, and reports.
Strong understanding of sales metrics and KPIs, such as Customer Lifetime Value (CLV), Lead Conversion Rates, and Sales Cycle Length.
Proven experience in conducting and interpreting funnel analysis to optimize sales processes.
Exceptional communication skills to present insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong business acumen with the ability to translate data into actionable recommendations for the sales team.
Experience collaborating with V- and C-level stakeholders, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.
Growth mindset and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
High degree of proactivity and self-sufficiency, capable of identifying opportunities and driving insights independently


Why join Usercentrics?


Joining Usercentrics means becoming part of a fast-growing, diverse and international team of tech enthusiasts and entrepreneurially-minded who build our success story together
Company culture is important to us - we strive to continuously develop a positive, vibrant and inspiring environment that enables everyone to thrive both personally and professionally
Get involved! We have plenty of initiatives and love to see people from all department enthusiastically participating and shaping our future together in different cross-department projects
Your work-life balance is important to us too - we offer flexible working hours, hybrid working and the possibility of workcations (in accordance with our company policy)
We always remember to have fun along the way, both in our day-to-day work and at our regular team events on site in our offices in Munich, Copenhagen, Odense, Lisbon and Prague or online
You are the most valuable asset to our company which is why we‚Äôre happy to offer awesome benefits like our personal development budget, job-related language courses and a lot more (depending on your location) to focus on your well being


About Us

We are driven by our values #BeBrave, #BetterTogether, #LeadbyExample, #InnovateWithPurpose, #PassionForPrivacy, #GiveBack and #ComeAsYouAre. They show what we believe in and how we work. They help make our team special and guide us in everything we do. They're the heart of our company and inspire us to do our best every day.

We strive to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment (DEI) where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are our greatest strengths ‚Äî so we are committed to building with them as we foster innovation and drive our success.

We recognize that this is an ongoing journey. We commit to listening and to continuous learning, growth, and improvement. By embracing DEI principles, we will create a more just and equitable society, and we are proud to play our part in making this vision a reality.

We are #BetterTogether.
Show more

We recognize that this is an ongoing journey. We commit to listening and to continuous learning, growth, and improvement. By embracing DEI principles, we will create a more just and equitable society, and we are proud to play our part in making this vision a reality.

We are #BetterTogether.

Title: Power BI Consultant
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good.

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

We are looking for a Consultant for the Power BI solution, who will also act as the guarantor of Modern BI and Data Visualization best practices. This role is key to ensuring the technical excellence and strategic evolution of our BI ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities


Act as the go-to expert for Power BI, ensuring adherence to best practices in data visualization and modern BI.
Administer Power BI Services, including workspace organization, access rights, role and authorization management, and data encryption.
Optimize performance through data compression, partitioning, and aggregation strategies.
Design and maintain advanced data models and ensure alignment with broader data architecture.
Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders to understand needs and translate them into effective BI solutions.
Drive continuous improvement through bug fixes, enhancements, and technical quality assurance.


Qualifications


2/3 years of hands-on experience with Power BI implementation.
Strong proficiency in DAX, SQL, and M (Power Query).
Deep understanding of data modeling and data architecture.
Experience with performance optimization techniques in Power BI.
Expertise in data visualization principles and storytelling with data.


Soft Skills


Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Comfortable interacting with both business and technical stakeholders.
Curious, proactive, and eager to stay up to date with BI trends and technologies.


Nice to Have


PL-300: Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst certification.
Experience with Google BigQuery.
Knowledge of Python and ETL tools.
Familiarity with Oracle Database and MongoDB.


Passionate about data, stunning visualizations, and cutting-edge tech? Join us and lead the way in transforming BI with Power BI!"
Show more

Title: Data Curator
Description:
Shape the future of innovation, startups & economies

Dealroom is the world‚Äôs startup and venture capital database, used by leading teams like Accel, Index, Atomico, Google, Microsoft, AWS, SAP, and 100+ governments, to discover the world‚Äôs next generation of transformative companies.

We‚Äôre on a mission to accelerate innovation by empowering decision-makers with the most comprehensive data on startups, scaleups, and ecosystems.

Joining Dealroom means working at the confluence of AI, big data, and venture capital and acting as a catalyst at the heart of startup ecosystems. We value relentless client focus, transparency, openness, and candour - the freedom to take risks, admit failures, and speak openly.

About The Data Curation Team

Join our team of data analysts and content curators to improve the quality and accuracy of our data, and to elevate the experience of our users. This role is ideal for team players and problem solvers with an investigative mind looking to enter the world of startups and venture capital. You will develop skills in data quality and classification while expanding your technical toolkit and co-creating scalable solutions. You'll often work directly with our clients.

As a Data Curator, you‚Äôll


Ensure data quality through curation, desk research, classification, content review, and moderation.
Support data operations workflows and assist engineering teams.
Monitor and improve data quality metrics.
Contribute to developing scalable data management solutions.


What You Bring


Academic Credentials: A completed Bachelor's degree in (Business) Information Technology, Finance, Economics, Content Management, or related fields.
Interests: Data and data management tools, from GenAI to Python and BigQuery.
Passion: A demonstrated enthusiasm for technology, startups, and venture capital markets.
Mindset: A proactive, accountable, and urgent approach to work.
Adaptability: Comfort in a fast-paced startup environment where continuous learning, OKRs, ongoing feedback, and curiosity drive success.
Eligibility: Eligibility to work in the EU, residency in the Lisbon area, and fluency in English. Additional language skills are welkom / wilkommen / bienvenido / kyaosopartaal.


What We Bring To The Deal


Ownership: A role where you truly own your work. Show us your capabilities, and we‚Äôll support your growth.
Comprehensive Benefits: Enjoy benefits like a laptop of your choice, flexible hours, a fully equipped home office setup, travel allowances, a development budget, weekly workout sessions, and more.
Global & Inclusive Culture: Join a diverse team spanning over 25 nationalities.
Vibrant Workplace: Work in a dynamic environment in the heart of Lisbon (Baixa-Chiado) with flexible hybrid options.
Meritocratic Environment: We value entrepreneurial thinking and are committed to turning innovative ideas into reality.


Ready to accelerate the future of innovation with us? Share your story, and let‚Äôs create something transformative together.

Title: UT/UTCD Data Analyst [Level 3]
Description:
PIPECARE Europe is currently looking for UT/UTCD Data Analyst [Level 3].

By providing technology and service focused solutions to the international arena of the oil and gas industry, the PipeCare Group of companies has been helping our customers ensure the integrity of their pipeline and facility assets for over 20 years. Due to our global focus and international growth, Pipecare is seeking experienced UT/UTCD Data Analyst [Level 3] to support our continued growth.

Selected candidate will be working with our project execution teams to ensure the timely and accurate reporting of in-line inspection results, with focus on our custom-tailored reporting solutions to satisfy our customers‚Äô needs. This includes the review of customer requirement specifications, processing of in-line inspection data, the analysis and identification of pipeline features and anomalies within processed data sets, application of industry accepted anomaly assessment criteria, ensuring the quality and accuracy of the final results, and compiling the results of our inspection activities in a concise, comprehensive custom tailored report for our customers.

Industry/sector: Oil & Gas / In Line Inspection services

Qualification: Data Analyst in UT/UTCD technology [Level 3]

Min years of experience: minimum last 15+ years working as UT/UTCD Data Analyst

Other requirements: solution ‚Äì oriented attitude; hands on approach; disciplined; team player; self-motivated

Responsibilities include:


Checking and approving the tool performance during the PTT
Checking the data quality of ILI runs
UTWM Data Analysis
UTCD Data Analysis
EMAT Data Analysis
Checking and implementing dig verification task at sites and preparing relevant reports
Reviewing the software inter phase
Reviewing software user manuals
Preparing/Reviewing DAD quality documentation
To ensure accurate tool sensitivity values are provided to TM in Tool Checklist
To prepare a specific Run assessment report
To identify obstructions in the pipeline; to produce technically valid Preliminary / Final report (if applicable)
To produce technically valid Preliminary / Final report
To inform HO-DAD about the results and/or to implement the results into the reports
To ensure that the coordinates are synchronized with the data
To alert the R&D regarding the software problems
To update the documentation
To produce updated standard quality procedures
To alert the DA Team Leader / DA Manager regarding the software problems
Execute all other tasks as requested by DA Team Leader or DA Manager and/or Executive Team within the assigned job role
Qualified Candidates will possess:


Minimum 4-year technical or engineering degree from an accredited university (experience in the analysis of in-line inspection data may be considered in lieu of education on case by case basis)
Prior certification as ILI PQ LIII Data Analyst in one or more of the following in-line inspection technologies: UTWM, UTCD, EMAT; or the ability to become certified
Minimum 15 years of experience in the analysis of in-line inspection data
Ability to learn proprietary software platforms; proficiency in Microsoft based applications is a must
Proficiency in English, both verbal and written
A professional, detail-oriented focus and attention to detail and high quality
Ability to communicate effectively to all organizational levels, prepare and make presentations to management and customers on all levels


Job requirements:


Ability to work for extended periods of time in a stationary position at computers and workstations
Ability to pass vision acuity and color differentiation examinations
Business travel may be required for internal training, internal meetings, site visits, and customer meetings [international travel may be required]
Ability to work flexible hours based on business and project needs
Ability to work either independently or within a team to ensure project success


Physical and Mental Requirements:


Lifting and Carrying: Ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds
Mobility: Must be able to walk and climb to perform duties, including maneuvering within a refinery or plant environment and accessing elevated platforms via ladders and stairwells
Communication: Sufficient clarity of speech and hearing, or other communication capabilities, to communicate effectively
Focus and Multitasking: Ability to maintain focus and multitask effectively
Safety Equipment: Must be able to wear safety equipment as required by the safety department for personal protection, if/where needed in manufacturing environments.
Personal Mobility and Reflexes: Sufficient personal mobility and physical reflexes, with or without reasonable accommodations, to perform office duties and travel to off-site locations when necessary


About PIPECARE Group:

PIPECARE Group offers comprehensive In-Line Inspection Services to identify and size pipeline threats, Utilizing advanced technologies such as Magnetic Flux Leakage, Transverse Field Inspection, Ultrasound, and specialized tools, PIPECARE ensures precise detection and assessment of various pipeline anomalies.

What we do:

In-Line Inspection Services

PIPECARE provides In-Line Inspection Services to locate, identify, and size threats, supporting integrity management requirements.

Check out our AI Technology and other cutting-edge technologies by clicking the following YouTube Links:

PIPECARE Group - YouTube

SMART AI CALIPER - Inspection Experience Like Never Before

Inspection Technologies

Magnetic Flux Leakage (MFL): Detects and sizes general corrosion and metal loss anomalies, especially circumferentially oriented.

Transverse Field Inspection (TFI): Detects and sizes general corrosion and metal loss anomalies, primarily axially oriented.

Ultrasound (UT): Detects and sizes general and other metal loss anomalies with high depth sizing accuracy.

Ultrasonic Crack Detection: Detects and sizes cracks and colonies of cracks.

Caliper (Geometry): Detects and sizes deviations in the ideal circular shape of a pipeline (dents, ovalities, wrinkles, etc.).

Specialized Tools and Technologies

Combo Tools: Use multiple measurement systems in various combinations.

Specialized Tubing Technologies: Designed for Furnace and Downhole Operations.

Equal Opportunity Employer: We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

  • Conhecimentos de linguagens de programa√ß√£o (R e VBA)
  • Capacidade de racioc√≠nio anal√≠tico
  • Capacidade de comunica√ß√£o e storytelling com base em dados

Why Ayvens?

With over 3.4 million vehicles managed across more than 42 countries, we provide full-service leasing, flexible subscription services, fleet management services and multi-mobility solutions to customers of all sizes, including large corporates, SMEs, professionals, and private individuals. By leveraging our unique position to lead the way to net zero and further shape the digital transformation of the industry, we are well-positioned to meet the evolving mobility needs of our clients and provide them with the solutions they need to thrive.

At Ayvens, we believe that our success is driven by our commitment to customer satisfaction. Our team is dedicated to delivering innovative solutions and technology-enabled services that help our customers focus on their everyday business. We‚Äôre committed to sustainable mobility and have made it a core part of our strategy. In everything we do, we‚Äôre guided by the principles of authenticity, curiosity, commitment and collaboration. We aim to foster an organisation that's diverse in people and ideas, where everyone can thrive and be themselves, no matter who they are.

Join us on this exciting journey as we continue to enable the transformation towards large scale adoption of sustainable mobility and provide our customers with the solutions they need to succeed. Follow our page for the latest updates, news, and insights.

Title: Data Analytics and Business Intelligence Senior (M/W)
Description:
Company Description

VANTIVA, headquartered in Paris, France and formerly known as Technicolor, is a global technology leader in designing, developing and supplying innovative products and solutions that connect consumers around the world to the content and services they love ‚Äì whether at home, at work or in other smart spaces.

VANTIVA has also earned a solid reputation for optimizing supply chain performance by leveraging its decades-long expertise in high-precision manufacturing, logistics, fulfilment and distribution. With operations throughout the Americas, Asia Pacific and EMEA, VANTIVA is recognized as a strategic partner by leading firms across various vertical industries, including network service providers, software companies and video game creators for over 25 years.

Our relationships with the film and entertainment industry goes back over 100 years by providing end-to-end solutions for our clients. VANTIVA is committed to the highest standards of corporate social responsibility and sustainability across all aspects of their operations.

For more information, please visit www.vantiva.com

Job Description

The BI expert will contribute to all aspects of BI development, covering Vantiva applications and supporting the implementation of the data strategy roadmap.

This role is critical in designing, developing, and maintaining data warehousing, reporting solutions, and BI applications. It requires a strong foundation in business intelligence, analytics, and functional expertise to interpret business requirements effectively.

The candidate will drive solution design, customization, and development to resolve issues, enhance existing solutions, and deliver new business intelligence capabilities.

The ideal candidate thrives in complex technical environments, enjoys problem-solving, and is passionate about data and analytics.

Key Responsibilities


Align and implement data architecture to support data analytics, reporting needs, and business planning requirements.
Ensure BI system health and performance by proposing, implementing, and monitoring best practices.
Maintain data reliability across all layers of the data platform and satellite systems.
Develop best practices for data visualization, dashboarding, planning, analytics, and application architecture.
Conduct root cause analysis and provide recommendations to leadership to mitigate risks and improve efficiency.
Ensure compliance with core solution principles and industry regulations for data handling and reporting.
Implement and maintain data security measures to protect sensitive information.
Handle user support requests, prioritizing them based on business impact.
Perform necessary system configurations and developments as needed.
Collaborate extensively with business stakeholders to understand reporting & analytics needs and deliver solutions that meet their requirements.


Qualifications


Highly motivated, proactive, and a self-starter with a strong sense of ownership.
Strong experience in analyzing, diagnosing, designing, planning, executing, and evaluating BI solutions while meeting time, cost, and quality targets.
Excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal, and documentation skills.
10+ years of experience in data foundation, data management, data governance, and insights generation.
Senior-level expertise in SAP BI architecture and development tools, with a focus on BW/4HANA.
Hands-on experience with BW/4HANA, IP/BPC, SAC, BODS, BOBJ (Webi), and Analysis for Excel.
Exposure to HANA administration, including data provisioning, data tiering, security, and performance optimization.
Proficiency in ABAP development is required (programs, functions, object classes, WebDynpro).
Strong SQL skills with experience in query performance tuning.
Knowledge of MS Power BI, Azure Data Lake, and Data Factory is an advantage.
Databricks experience is a strong plus completed by a proficiency in Python.


Additional Information

The position is located in Lisbon, Portugal.

Our most important asset is our People

Vantiva‚Äôs success greatly relies on our people‚Äôs energy, motivation, and talent.

We are dedicated to cultivating a workforce that embraces and celebrates diversity as we believe our differences drive our creativity, and innovation.

We are proactive in supporting equality and maintaining an inclusive work environment, developing, and enhancing career opportunities for all.

If you require a reasonable accommodation at any step of the application process, please let us know by answering the dedicated question in this application form.

Title: Data Market Analyst ‚Äì Business Planning
Description:
Imagine a world with zero vehicle accidents, zero vehicle emissions, and wireless vehicle connectivity all around us. Every day, we move closer to making that world a reality. Aptiv‚Äôs passionate team of engineers and developers creates advanced safety systems, high-performance electrification solutions and data connectivity solutions so that automakers can bring advanced capabilities to more people around the globe. This is how we enable sustainable mobility and help to prevent accidents caused by human error.

Want to join us?

Your role:


Conduct internal planning data analysis, transform data into knowledge to provide input for decision, compare data with Market industry-level to support operational and strategic initiatives.
Monitor market share, competitive intelligence, product development trends and EDS portfolio to support market positioning reports.
Align data analysis with company‚Äôs strategic direction. Initiate and support market research and competitor analysis by developing automatization of different data sources.
Collaborate with external research and consulting firms to provide insights to internal functions and leadership.
Participate in customer studies and market environment analysis.
Maintain up-to-date understanding of the EMEA wiring harness market, including key drivers such as electrification, regulatory shifts, consumer behavior, and regional trends.
Contribute to general business planning tasks as needed and support Commercial Teams in regards current and future business.


Your Background


Graduate or Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field
Strong proficiency in SQL, Microsoft Excel, and Power BI.
Working knowledge of SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
Excellent command of office applications, including PowerPoint and Excel.
Familiarity with Automotive product portfolios and market forecasting.
Experience in market research, data analysis, or a related function.
Fluent in English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Able to perform under pressure, work collaboratively, and meet deadlines.


Nice To Have Skills


Experience with VBA, Power Query, Power Pivot, or Power Automate.
Automotive supplier background or direct exposure to manufacturing and business planning in the automotive sector.


Why join us?


You can grow at Aptiv. Aptiv provides an inclusive work environment where all individuals can grow and develop, regardless of gender, ethnicity or beliefs.
You can have an impact. Safety is a core Aptiv value; we want a safer world for us and our children, one with: Zero fatalities, Zero injuries, Zero accidents.
You have support. We ensure you have the resources and support you need to take care of your family and your physical and mental health with a competitive health insurance package.


Privacy Notice - Active Candidates: https://www.aptiv.com/privacy-notice-active-candidates

Aptiv is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee - Real Assets
Description:
About The Job


Data is a strategic asset for BNP Paribas. It plays a fundamental role in the analysis of the teams‚Äô performance and evolution ultimately allowing to become more efficient and to contribute to the sustainability of the business model and the accurate selection of the bank‚Äôs assets. To be in control of data is crucial to enhance risk management, to reach right credit decisions and bring added value to the business
Based in Lisbon, the Trainee will join a team of professionals who are known for their sectorial knowledge and support the team


Your Main Activities Are


Input missing data on credit files for presentation to the Credit Committee
Ensure accuracy of credit data
Ensure consistency of data between different credit files
Communicate with the CPM Credit Analyst Teams aiming to get updates on progress of credit files
Ensure proper understanding of credit files to identify structured data to be inputted
Create and maintain standard procedures for data input (user guides)
Cooperate and communicate with the teams in charge of the golden source systems to ensure correct data in the source system
Produce periodic reports based on data collected and captured, providing clear analysis and interpretation


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Economics, Accounting or Management
Detail oriented with deep interest in data
Good knowledge of Excel
Good written/verbal communication skills in English (mandatory)
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Efficient organizational and planning capacities
Self-starter, good initiative and flexible


About The Team


The Real Assets team includes a Coverage Relationship & Origination team, a Transaction & Execution team and a Credit Portfolio Management Team (CPM) spread across several countries serving the sector client in EMEA. These teams are split across Transportation (Shipping & Offshore, Aviation, Rail), Real Estate, Energy, Recourses & Infrastructure (ERI), Export, Leasing & Alternative Structuring. This transversality aims to provide a common training path, opportunities to explore other sectors, more efficiency and greater mobility


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

  • The Real Assets team includes a Coverage Relationship & Origination team, a Transaction & Execution team and a Credit Portfolio Management Team (CPM) spread across several countries serving the sector client in EMEA. These teams are split across Transportation (Shipping & Offshore, Aviation, Rail), Real Estate, Energy, Recourses & Infrastructure (ERI), Export, Leasing & Alternative Structuring. This transversality aims to provide a common training path, opportunities to explore other sectors, more efficiency and greater mobility

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Description

Who is Defined.ai? Well, from a technical point of view, we leverage the power of a global crowd to provide some of the world‚Äôs biggest companies with the high-quality data they need to power their artificial intelligence. We‚Äôre instrumental to the progression and development of artificial intelligence and we couldn‚Äôt be prouder or more inspired to be involved in an industry that is changing the world.

From a personal point of view, we‚Äôre a group of big thinkers, high achievers and creative problem solvers. We bond over our shared love of software engineering, data science, and strong coffee. We like online gaming, running marathons, and team drinks. We celebrate authenticity and diversity and we‚Äôre invested in what we do. Our mission? World domination, obviously!

What will you do?

  • Design and implement scalable PySpark-based data pipelines to process (clean, validate, package and deliver) multimodal AI training datasets (e.g., text, audio, video, images, etc.);
  • Develop ETL pipelines to fuel the Operations areas with data for their analytical dashboards;
  • Set software engineering tools, platforms, and best practices while performing trade-off analysis to best match engineering, product, and project constraints and expectations;
  • Operate data pipelines to ingest data from multiple sources, and deliver it to different destinations.
  • Help the Product Manager and stakeholders in structuring, breaking down, and prioritizing the product roadmap into backlog work items;
  • Collaborate with other software engineering teams such as SREs and DevOps to achieve your team‚Äôs goals;
  • Work together with Software Engineering teams so as to integrate the Data Platform with other tools and platforms.

Who are we looking for?

Do you have the drive to work in an innovative and ambitious environment?

We‚Äôre looking for someone with a determined and proactive mindset, someone inspired and passionate to help us achieve our goals. Our successful candidate is a strong critical thinker, reliable and transparent, with an ability to learn and communicate. We are looking for someone special to contribute to our unique culture.

  • BSc or MSc in Computer Science or similar background;
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience;
  • Experience in PySpark-based data pipelines and software quality best practices;
  • Worked with Azure services such as Synapse Analytics (mainly PySpark Jobs, Pipelines, and Notebooks), ADLS, Power BI, DevOps, and SQL and NoSQL databases;
  • Solid understanding of data-related architectures, concepts, technologies, and processes (e.g., Medallion, Data Lake, Data Lakehouse, Data Warehouse, ETL, etc.);
  • Comfortable with evaluating and applying software design and architectural patterns/principles;
  • Knowledge of RESTful APIs based on FastAPI, from the provider as well as the consumer point of view;
  • Problem Solving skills;
  • Proficient in both written and spoken English.

Benefits

You spend a lot of your time at work, so it should be challenging, fun and interesting. At Defined.ai it will be all of those things and more. Here‚Äôs what we offer:

  • Flexible working schedule and hybrid model. We know comfort can boost creativity and performance, so you can manage your schedule and work both from one of our modern office spaces or home.
  • Excellent career development opportunities in a high growth company. With us, you can accomplish your career goals and follow a well-described career path with the support of your supervisor.
  • Culture of feedback and continuous improvement. AI is a fast-paced area, so we keep track of tech trends, and we always ask for feedback.
  • An international and diverse team. We have more than 30 nationalities at our 3 locations, and we provide language classes.
  • Continuous training opportunities. You can choose from many options: leveraging hand-on workshops, unlimited access to Udemy and formal development opportunities.
  • We love to have fun together. We joke a lot, and we can't imagine work without fun activities ‚Äì we already surfed, raced carts and played soccer together.

About Us

Defined.ai offers a platform with multiple data delivery options that leverages machine learning technology and human intelligence to deliver quality-guaranteed training data for AI systems. The platform offers self-service and fully customizable solutions that deliver high-quality project-specific training data, enabling AI products reach market quicker. It is this business model that has allowed Defined.ai to raise a total of $63.6M in funding over 4 rounds. Our value proposition is quality, privacy, speed and scale, covering more than 50 different languages. With strong expertise in speech and natural language processing technologies, we have been serving AI companies and Fortune 500 companies since day one. Defined.ai was founded in Seattle and has offices in Lisbon and Porto.

Title: Data Visualization Specialist
Description:
About The Job


We are seeking a talented Senior Data Visualization Expert to join the CIB Human Resources team. As a Senior Data Visualization Expert, you will play a crucial role in transforming complex HR data into clear and actionable insights through visually compelling representations. Your work will empower our HR teams to make data-driven decisions that drive the success of our organization


Your Main Activities Are


Data Visualization: Create visually appealing and interactive data visualizations, including charts, graphs, dashboards, and reports, using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms
Storytelling: Translate data findings into compelling narratives to convey insights effectively to HR and organizational stakeholders
Data Analysis: Analyse large volumes of HR data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement
Data Integration: Collaborate with the HR and IT teams to integrate and maintain data sources to ensure data accuracy and completeness. Play a key role in sprint planning and contribute in daily standup meetings to ensure on time delivery of new developments
Data Quality Assurance: Implement data validation and quality control procedures to ensure data accuracy and reliability
User Training: Train HR staff on interpreting and using visualized data for informed decision-making
Project Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support HR-related projects and initiative
Stay Current: Keep up-to-date with industry best practices and emerging data visualization tools and techniques
Provide end user support and follow up with IT teams on any production incidents/issues and ensure they are resolved in a timely manor


Profile And Skills To Success


Masters Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
At least 3 years of experience in data analysis and visualization, preferably in a Human Resources context
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Data driven mindset / exploratory data analysis
Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a team and meet project deadlines
Flexibility: ability to work in a changing environment
Project management skills
Facilitate problem solving & collaboration


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.
